subsection (7B) insert—

214.4.7C

The order may make provision as to circumstances in which a distributor or
supplier may meet the whole or any part of a carbon emissions reduction target
by making a buy-out payment.

214.4.7D

In this section, “ buy-out payment ” means a payment—

214.4.7D.a

of an amount (“ the buy-out price ”) determined by the Secretary of State,

214.4.7D.b

to a person approved by the Administrator (an “approved person”),

214.4.7D.c

for a purpose approved by the Administrator (an “approved purpose”).

214.4.7E

Provision made by virtue of subsection  (7C)  may include provision about the
determination by the Secretary of State of the buy-out price, including
provision—

214.4.7E.a

enabling the Secretary of State to set different buy-out prices—

214.4.7E.a.i

for different parts of the period to which the order relates;

214.4.7E.a.ii

for different cases (including different buy-out prices for different
distributors or suppliers);

214.4.7E.b

requiring the Secretary of State to publish the buy-out price.

214.4.7F

If the order makes provision by virtue of subsection  (7C) , the order may
also make provision—

214.4.7F.a

as to the procedure to be followed by the Administrator in approving a person
as an approved person or a purpose as an approved purpose;

214.4.7F.b

specifying criteria by reference to which the Administrator is to determine
whether to approve a person or purpose.

214.4.7G

Provision made by virtue of subsection  (7C)  may include further provision
about buy-out payments, including in particular provision—

214.4.7G.a

as to the procedure to be followed by a distributor or supplier who proposes
to make a buy-out payment, including provision—

214.4.7G.a.i

requiring a distributor or supplier to notify the Administrator of specified
matters by a specified time;

214.4.7G.a.ii

as to circumstances in which a distributor or supplier must make the buy-out
payment to which notification given to the Administrator relates;

214.4.7G.a.iii

about the process for seeking approval of a person as an approved person, or
of a purpose as an approved purpose;

214.4.7G.b

preventing a distributor or supplier from treating a buy-out payment as a
payment pursuant to any other obligation (whether statutory or contractual),
or vice versa;

214.4.7G.c

setting out circumstances in which a requirement imposed on a distributor or
supplier by provision made by virtue of subsection (5)(ba) or (bb) may be—

214.4.7G.c.i

met, in whole or in part, by the making of a buy-out payment;

214.4.7G.c.ii

varied as a result of a buy-out payment;

214.4.7G.d

about the effect of provision included in the order by virtue of subsection
(7)(c) to (e) on a person’s ability to meet the whole or any part of a carbon
emissions reduction target by making a buy-out payment.

214.4.7H

Where an order includes provision for the making of a buy-out payment, the
references in subsections (5)(be) and (7)(b) to action include a reference to
the making of a buy-out payment.

214.5

In section 41AA of the Electricity Act 1989 (Scottish Ministers’ promotion of
reductions in carbon emissions: electricity suppliers)—

214.5.a

in subsection (3)—

214.5.a.i

in paragraph (b), after “(7)(a)” insert  “,  (7C) ,  (7E) ” ;

214.5.a.ii

after paragraph (c) insert—

214.5.a.ii.ca

in  subsection (7F) , for “order makes” is substituted  “Secretary of State
has made” ;

214.5.a.ii.cb

in  subsection (7G) , for “ (7C) ” is substituted  “ (7F) ” ;

214.5.a.ii.cc

in  subsection (7H) , for “an order includes” is substituted  “the Secretary
of State has made” ;

;

214.5.a.iii

in paragraph (g), after “place” insert  “other than in  subsection (7D) (a) ”
;

214.5.b

in subsection (9)(a), for “or (7)(a)” substitute  “, (7)(a),  (7C)  or  (7E) ”
.

214.6

In subsection 41BA of the Electricity Act 1989 (Scottish Ministers’ promotion
of reductions in home-heating costs: electricity suppliers)—

214.6.a

in subsection (3)—

214.6.a.i

in paragraph (c), after “(7)(a)” insert  “,  (7C) ,  (7E) ” ;

214.6.a.ii

after paragraph (d) insert—

214.6.a.ii.da

in section 41A (7F)  as applied by subsection (4), for “order makes” is
substituted  “Secretary of State has made” ;

214.6.a.ii.db

in section 41A (7G)  as applied by subsection (4), for “ (7C) ” is substituted
“ (7F) ” ;

214.6.a.ii.dc

in section 41A (7H)  as applied by subsection (4), for “an order includes” is
substituted  “the Secretary of State has made” ;

;

214.6.a.iii

in paragraph (h), after “subsection (4)” insert  “other than in section 41A
(7D) (a) ” ;

214.6.b

.

November 2023” substitute  “1 November 2028” ;

this section comes into force.

In the Smart Meters Act 2018, omit section 1.

### Heat networks

#### Regulation of heat networks

##### Relevant heat network

216

216.1

In this Chapter, “ relevant heat network ” means—

216.1.a

a district heat network, or

216.1.b

a communal heat network.

216.2

In  this section —

      “ communal heat network ” means a heat network by means of which
heating, cooling or hot water is supplied only to a single building divided
into separate premises or persons in those premises;           “ district heat
network ” means a heat network by means of which heating, cooling or hot water
is supplied to two or more buildings or persons in those buildings;
“ heat network ” means a network that, by distributing a liquid or a gas,
enables the transfer of thermal energy for the purpose of supplying heating,
cooling or hot water to a building or persons in that building (and includes
any appliance the main purpose of which is to heat or cool the liquid or gas).

216.3

For the purposes of  subsection (2) , a network is not excluded from being a
heat network only by reason of its being designed to rely wholly or in part on
heat pumps particular to the buildings or premises served by the network.

216.4

The Secretary of State may by regulations amend this section for the purposes
of changing the definitions of “relevant heat network”, “district heat
network”, “communal heat network” and “heat network”.

216.5

Regulations under this section are subject to the affirmative procedure.

##### The Regulator

217

217.1

In this Chapter, “ the Regulator ” means—

217.1.a

in relation to England and Wales and Scotland, the GEMA, and

217.1.b

in relation to Northern Ireland, the NIAUR.

217.2

The Secretary of State may by regulations provide for functions of the
Regulator in relation to England and Wales and Scotland to be carried out, to
the extent specified in the regulations, by a person or body other than the
GEMA.

217.3

The Department may by regulations provide for functions of the Regulator in
relation to Northern Ireland to be carried out, to the extent specified in the
regulations, by a person or body other than the NIAUR.

217.4

The Secretary of State may by regulations make such amendments of this Part as
appear to the Secretary of State to be appropriate in consequence of provision
made by virtue of  subsection (2)  or  (3) .

217.5

The Department may by regulations make such amendments of this Part as appear
to the Department to be appropriate in consequence of provision made by virtue
of  subsection (3) .

217.6

Regulations made by the Secretary of State under this section are subject to
the affirmative procedure.

217.7

The power of the Department to make regulations under this section is
exercisable by statutory rule for the purposes of the Statutory Rules
(Northern Ireland) Order 1979 ( S.I. 1979/1573 (N.I. 12)) .

217.8

Regulations made by the Department under this section may not be made unless a
draft of the regulations has been laid before and approved by a resolution of
the Northern Ireland Assembly.

##### Alternative dispute resolution for consumer disputes

218

218.1

The Department may by regulations amend the Alternative Dispute Resolution for
Consumer Disputes (Competent Authorities and Information) Regulations 2015 (
S.I. 2015/542 ) so as to provide for a person who, or a body which, from time
to time carries out to any extent in relation to Northern Ireland the
functions conferred on the Regulator by this Chapter to be a competent
authority for the purposes of those regulations.

218.2

The power of the Department to make regulations under this section is
exercisable by statutory rule for the purposes of the Statutory Rules
(Northern Ireland) Order 1979 ( S.I. 1979/1573 (N.I. 12)) .

218.3

Regulations made by the Department under this section may not be made unless a
draft of the regulations has been laid before and approved by a resolution of
the Northern Ireland Assembly.

##### Heat networks regulations

219

219.1

The appropriate authority may by regulations make provision for the purposes
of—

219.1.a

regulating relevant heat networks, or

219.1.b

conferring powers in relation to the development or maintenance of relevant
heat networks.

219.2

Schedule 18  contains further provision about the power to make regulations
under  this section .

219.3

The provision made in  Schedule 18  is without prejudice to the generality of
subsection (1).

219.4

Regulations under this section may—

219.4.a

contain such consequential, incidental, supplementary, transitional or saving
provisions as the appropriate authority considers appropriate;

219.4.b

make different provision for different purposes;

219.4.c

provide for a person to exercise discretion in dealing with any matter.

219.5

Regulations made by the Secretary of State by virtue of  subsection (4) (a)
may include—

219.5.a

provisions amending or repealing an Act of Parliament, an Act or Measure of
Senedd Cymru or Northern Ireland legislation;

219.5.b

provisions amending the Heat Networks (Scotland) Act  2021 (asp 9) .

219.6

Regulations made by the Department by virtue of  subsection (4) (a)  may
include provisions amending or repealing Northern Ireland legislation.

219.7

Before making any regulations under this section, the appropriate authority is
to consult such persons or bodies as it may consider appropriate.

219.8

It is immaterial for the purposes of  subsection (7)  whether consultation is
carried out before or after the coming into force of  this section .

219.9

In this section “ the appropriate authority ” means—

219.9.a

in relation to England and Wales and Scotland, the Secretary of State;

219.9.b

in relation to Northern Ireland, the Department.

##### Regulations made by Secretary of State: consultation with devolved authorities

220

220.1

This section applies where—

220.1.a

the Secretary of State proposes to make regulations under  section 219  by
virtue of any of Parts  3 ,  4 ,  5 ,  7 ,  8 ,  10 ,  11  and  12  of
Schedule 18 , and

220.1.b

the regulations contain—

220.1.b.i

in the case of regulations made by virtue of Part  3 ,  4 ,  7 ,  8 ,  10 ,
11  or  12  of  Schedule 18 , provision within Scottish devolved competence;

220.1.b.ii

in the case of regulations made by virtue of Part  5  of  Schedule 18 ,
provision within Welsh devolved competence.

220.2

Before making the regulations, the Secretary of State must give notice—

220.2.a

stating that the Secretary of State proposes to make the regulations,

220.2.b

setting out or describing—

220.2.b.i

so far as the regulations are made as mentioned in  subsection (1) (b) (i) ,
the provision within Scottish devolved competence,

220.2.b.ii

so far as the regulations are made as mentioned in  subsection (1) (b) (ii) ,
the provision within Welsh devolved competence, and

220.2.c

specifying the period (of not less than 28 days from the date on which the
notice is given) within which representations may be made with respect to
those provisions,

and must consider any representations duly made and not withdrawn.

220.3

A notice under subsection  (2)  must be given to each relevant devolved
authority, that is to say—

220.3.a

the Scottish Ministers, if the regulations are made as mentioned in
subsection (1) (b) (i)  and contain provision within Scottish devolved
competence;

220.3.b

the Welsh Ministers, if the regulations are made as mentioned in  subsection
(1) (b) (ii)  and contain provision within Welsh devolved competence.

220.4

The Secretary of State need not wait until the end of the period specified
under subsection  (2) (c)  before making regulations if, before the end of
that period, each relevant devolved authority to which the notice was given
has confirmed that it has made any representations it intends to make with
respect to the provision referred to in  subsection (2) (b) (i)  or  (ii)  (as
the case may be).

220.5

The Secretary of State must, if requested to do so by a relevant devolved
authority, give the authority a statement setting out whether and how
representations made by the authority with respect to the provision referred
to in  subsection (2) (b) (i)  or  (ii)  (as the case may be) have been taken
into account in the regulations.

220.6

For the purposes of this section, provision—

220.6.a

is within Scottish devolved competence if it would be within the legislative
competence of the Scottish Parliament if it were contained in an Act of that
Parliament;

220.6.b

is within Welsh devolved competence if it would be within the legislative
competence of Senedd Cymru if it were contained in an Act of the Senedd
(ignoring any requirement for the consent of a Minister of the Crown imposed
under Schedule 7B to the Government of Wales Act 2006).

221

221.1

The first regulations to be made by the Secretary of State under  section 219
are subject to the affirmative procedure.

221.2

The following regulations made by the Secretary of State are also subject to
the affirmative procedure—

221.2.a

regulations under  section 219  which are made by virtue of—

221.2.a.i

paragraph 12 (1)  of  Schedule 18 ,

221.2.a.ii

paragraph 23 (1)  of  Schedule 18 ,

221.2.a.iii

paragraph 32  of  Schedule 18 ,

221.2.a.iv

any provision of  Part 8  or  9  of  Schedule 18 , or

221.2.a.v

paragraph 56  of  Schedule 18 ;

221.2.b

regulations under  section 219  which create an offence or provide for an
increase in the penalty for an existing offence;

221.2.c

regulations under  section 219  which amend or repeal any provision of
legislation mentioned in  section 219 (5) .

221.3

Any other regulations made by the Secretary of State under  section 219  are
subject to the negative procedure.

221.4

The power of the Department to make regulations under  section 219  is
exercisable by statutory rule for the purposes of the Statutory Rules
(Northern Ireland) Order 1979 ( S.I. 1979/1573 (N.I. 12)) .

221.5

The first regulations to be made by the Department under  section 219  may not
be made unless a draft of the regulations has been laid before and approved by
a resolution of the Northern Ireland Assembly.

221.6

Regulations made by the Department under  section 219  containing any of the
following regulations (whether alone or with other regulations) may not be
made unless a draft of the regulations has been laid before and approved by a
resolution of the Northern Ireland Assembly—

221.6.a

regulations under  section 219  which are made by virtue of—

221.6.a.i

paragraph 12 (1)  of  Schedule 18 ,

221.6.a.ii

paragraph 32  of  Schedule 18 ,

221.6.a.iii

any provision of  Part 8  or  9  of  Schedule 18 , or

221.6.a.iv

paragraph 56  of  Schedule 18 ;

221.6.b

regulations under section  219  which create an offence or provide for an
increase in the penalty for an existing offence;

221.6.c

regulations under  section 219  which amend or repeal any provision of
Northern Ireland legislation.

221.7

Any other regulations made by the Department under  section 219  are subject
to negative resolution within the meaning of section 41(6) of the
Interpretation Act (Northern Ireland)  1954 (c. 33 (N.I.)) .

##### Recovery of costs by GEMA and NIAUR

222

222.1

The conditions of a licence under section 7, 7ZA, 7A or 7AB of the Gas Act
1986 or section 6 of the Electricity Act 1989 may require payment by the
licence holder of sums relating to costs within  subsection (2) .

222.2

The costs within this subsection are—

222.2.a

costs of the GEMA—

222.2.a.i

under regulations made under section  219 , or

222.2.a.ii

in its capacity as the licensing authority for the purposes of the Heat
Networks (Scotland) Act  2021 (asp 9) , if the GEMA is designated as such
under section  223 (1) of this Act,

222.2.b

217 (2)  or paragraph  5  of  Schedule 18 , functions of the Regulator,

222.2.c

costs of holders of licences issued under  Part 4  of  Schedule 18  (code
manager licences),

222.2.d

costs incurred by the Secretary of State in giving financial assistance under
regulations made by virtue of paragraph  50  of  Schedule 18  (special
administration regime),

222.2.e

costs incurred by a person or body in providing, or arranging for the
provision of, consumer advocacy and advice in relation to heat network
consumers, and

222.2.f

costs not within any of paragraphs (a) to (e) incurred by a person in
exercising a function in relation to heat networks in England, Wales or
Scotland (whether by virtue of regulations under section  219  or otherwise).

222.3

The conditions of a licence under Article 8 of the Gas (Northern Ireland)
Order 1996 ( S.I. 1996/275 (N.I. 2))  or Article 10 of the Electricity
(Northern Ireland) Order 1992 ( S.I. 1992/231 (N.I. 1))  may require payment
by the licence holder of sums relating to costs within  subsection (4) .

222.4

The costs within this subsection are—

222.4.a

costs of the NIAUR under regulations made under section  219 ,

222.4.b

costs of a person other than the NIAUR in carrying out, by virtue of  section
217 (3)  or paragraph  5  of  Schedule 18 , functions of the Regulator,

222.4.c

costs incurred by the Department in giving financial assistance under
regulations made by virtue of paragraph  50  of  Schedule 18  (special
administration regime),

222.4.d

costs incurred by a person or body in providing, or arranging for the
provision of, consumer advocacy and advice in relation to heat network
consumers, and

222.4.e

costs not within any of paragraphs (a) to (d) incurred by a person in
exercising a function in relation to heat networks in Northern Ireland
(whether by virtue of regulations under section  219  or otherwise).

223.3.a

##### Heat networks: enforcement in Scotland

224

224.1

The Secretary of State may by regulations amend the Heat Networks (Scotland)
Act 2021 for the purpose of making provision about monitoring compliance with,
or enforcement of, conditions of heat networks licences issued under section
5(5) of that Act.

224.2

Regulations under  this section  may, in particular, make provision
corresponding to the provision described in  paragraphs 6  to  10 ,  37  to
40 ,  43 ,  72  and  73  of  Schedule 18 .

224.3

Regulations under  this section  must provide for an offence created by the
regulations—

224.3.a

to be triable only summarily, and

224.3.b

to be punishable on conviction with imprisonment for a period not exceeding 3
months or a fine not exceeding level 1 on the standard scale (or both).

224.4

The Secretary of State may make regulations under this section only if the
Secretary of State has also made regulations under  section 223 (1)  (and
those regulations are still in force).

224.5

Regulations under this section are subject to the affirmative procedure.

##### Interpretation of Chapter 1

225

In this Chapter—

      “ the Department ” means the Department for the Economy in Northern
Ireland;           “ heat network ” has the meaning given by  section 216 ;
“ the NIAUR ” means the Northern Ireland Authority for Utility Regulation;
“ the Regulator ” has the meaning given by  section 217 ;           “ relevant
heat network ” has the meaning given by  section 216 .

#### Heat network zones

##### Zones regulations

###### Regulations about heat network zones

226

226.1

The Secretary of State may by regulations make provision about heat network
zones (“ zones regulations ”).

226.2

A heat network zone is an area in England that is designated as such under
zones regulations by virtue of being appropriate for the construction and
operation of one or more district heat networks.

226.3

The provision made by this Chapter is without prejudice to the generality of
subsection (1) .

226.4

Subject to  subsection (5) , zones regulations are subject to the affirmative
procedure.

226.5

Zones regulations which make provision of the kind described in  section 229
(1) (c)  or  (4) (c)  or  230 (2) (c)  or  (4)  (and no other provision) are
subject to the negative procedure.

226.6

If, apart from this section, a draft of an instrument containing zones
regulations would be treated for the purposes of the standing orders of either
House of Parliament as a hybrid instrument, it is to proceed in that House as
if it were not such an instrument.

##### Heat Network Zones Authority and zone coordinators

###### Heat Network Zones Authority

227

227.1

Zones regulations may designate a person to act as the Heat Network Zones
Authority (referred to in this Chapter as “ the Authority ”).

227.2

The purpose of the Authority is to carry out functions in relation to heat
network zones conferred on it by zones regulations.

227.3

The Secretary of State may, but need not, be designated for the purposes of
subsection (1) .

227.4

Zones regulations may provide for the Authority to delegate any of its
functions to persons specified in the regulations.

###### Zone coordinators

228

228.1

Zones regulations may make provision about zone coordinators.

228.2

The purpose of zone coordinators is to carry out functions conferred on them
by zones regulations in relation to particular heat network zones.

228.3

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (1)  may—

228.3.a

make provision for, or in connection with, the designation of a person as a
zone coordinator by a local authority for its area, or a part or parts of its
area (including the local authority designating itself);

228.3.b

make provision for, or in connection with, the designation of a person as a
zone coordinator by two or more local authorities for their areas or parts of
their areas (including the local authorities designating one of themselves);

228.3.c

make provision for, or in connection with, the establishment of a body by one
or more local authorities which is intended to be designated as a zone
coordinator in accordance with regulations made by virtue of  paragraph (a)
or  (b) ;

228.3.d

make provision about the funding of zone coordinators;

228.3.e

make provision about the governance of zone coordinators;

228.3.f

make provision about zone coordinators cooperating with the Regulator in
relation to zone coordinators’ functions or the Regulator’s functions;

228.3.g

make provision for the Authority to perform any function of a zone coordinator
in circumstances, and subject to requirements, specified by the regulations;

228.3.h

make provision for the Authority to direct a zone coordinator to perform any
of its functions in the manner the Authority considers appropriate in
circumstances, and subject to requirements, specified by the regulations.

228.4

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (3) (a)  and  (b)  may make
provision for the Authority—

228.4.a

to require a local authority, or two or more local authorities, to designate a
person as a zone coordinator in circumstances, and subject to requirements,
specified by the regulations;

228.4.b

to designate a person as a zone coordinator where a local authority (or local
authorities) fail to comply with a requirement imposed by virtue of paragraph
(a) .

228.5

In  this section , “ local authority ” means—

228.5.a

a county, district or parish council in England;

228.5.b

a London borough council;

228.5.c

the Common Council of the City of London;

228.5.d

the Council of the Isles of Scilly;

228.5.e

a combined authority established under section 103 of the Local Democracy,
Economic Development and Construction Act 2009;

228.5.f

another body or person specified by zones regulations.

##### Identification, designation and review of zones

###### Identification, designation and review of zones

229

229.1

Zones regulations may make provision for, or in connection with—

229.1.a

the identification by the Authority and zone coordinators of areas which are
appropriate for the construction and operation of one or more district heat
networks,

229.1.b

the designation of those areas as heat network zones by zone coordinators or
the Authority, and

229.1.c

the review by zone coordinators, or the Authority, of the designation of areas
as heat network zones.

229.2

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (1) (a)  must require the
identification of areas to be carried out in accordance with the zoning
methodology established under  section 230 .

229.3

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (1) (b)  may—

229.3.a

make provision about the variation or revocation of designations by zone
coordinators or the Authority;

229.3.b

make provision about procedure;

229.3.c

make provision about the publication of designations (and the variation or
revocation of designations);

229.3.d

require zone coordinators to notify the Authority of designations (and the
variation or revocation of designations);

229.3.e

make provision for, or in connection with, the maintenance by the Authority of
a register of areas designated as heat network zones.

229.4

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (3) (a)  may, in particular—

229.4.a

specify the circumstances in which a zone coordinator or the Authority may
vary or revoke a designation;

229.4.b

specify the factors a zone coordinator or the Authority may or must take into
consideration in determining whether to vary or revoke a designation;

229.4.c

impose on zone coordinators or the Authority requirements as to consultation.

229.5

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (1) (c)  may—

229.5.a

make provision about the circumstances in which reviews must be carried out
and the frequency of reviews;

229.5.b

set out the criteria against which the designation of areas as heat network
zones is to be reviewed;

229.5.c

impose on zone coordinators or the Authority requirements as to consultation;

229.5.d

make provision requiring reports of reviews to be published.

###### Zoning methodology

230

230.1

Zones regulations may make provision for a methodology (to be known as “ the
zoning methodology ”) for the Authority and zone coordinators to identify
areas which are appropriate for the construction and operation of one or more
district heat networks.

230.2

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (1)  may include in the zoning
methodology—

230.2.a

the criteria for determining whether an area is appropriate;

230.2.b

the roles of the Authority and zone coordinators;

230.2.c

requirements as to consultation;

230.2.d

provision about how the identification of areas is to be recorded, including
provision about the use of maps;

230.2.e

requirements as to publication of areas which have been identified.

230.3

Zones regulations may make provision for the Authority to issue guidance in
relation to the zoning methodology.

230.4

Zones regulations may make provision about the Secretary of State carrying out
reviews of the zoning methodology.

230.5

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (4)  may—

230.5.a

make provision about the circumstances in which reviews must be carried out
and the frequency of reviews;

230.5.b

set out the criteria against which the zoning methodology is to be reviewed;

230.5.c

impose on the Secretary of State requirements as to consultation;

230.5.d

make provision for the Authority or zone coordinators to consult persons on
behalf of the Secretary of State;

230.5.e

make provision requiring reports of reviews to be published.

###### Requests for information in connection with 

231

231.1

Zones regulations may make provision about the Authority and zone coordinators
requesting information in connection with their functions under regulations
made by virtue of  section 229  or  230 .

231.2

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (1)  may provide for—

231.2.a

the Authority or a zone coordinator to request information by notice from a
person of a description specified in the regulations;

231.2.b

the requested information to be provided within the period, and in the form
and manner, specified in the notice;

231.2.c

the Authority or zone coordinator to impose a penalty on a person for not
complying with the notice;

231.2.d

the disclosing of information requested by the zone coordinator not to breach
any obligation of confidence owed by the person making the disclosure or any
other restriction on the disclosure of information (however imposed);

231.2.e

a request for information not to require a disclosure of information if
disclosure would contravene the data protection legislation (but for a
requirement imposed by virtue of regulations made by virtue of  subsection (1)
to be taken into account in determining whether a disclosure would do so);

231.2.f

zone coordinators to delegate functions conferred on them by regulations made
by virtue of  subsection (1)  to a description of person, and in the
circumstances and subject to the conditions, specified by the regulations.

##### Heat networks within zones

###### Heat networks within zones

232

232.1

Zones regulations may make provision about heat networks within heat network
zones.

232.2

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (1)  may, in particular—

232.2.a

make provision imposing requirements on persons of a description specified in
the regulations for the purpose of securing that buildings of types specified
by the regulations situated within a heat network zone are connected to a
district heat network within the zone—

232.2.a.i

in circumstances specified by the regulations, and

232.2.a.ii

within a time specified by, or determined in accordance with, the regulations;

232.2.b

make provision about zone coordinators giving notice of requirements imposed
by regulations made by virtue of  paragraph (a)  to persons on whom
requirements are imposed;

232.2.c

make provision about the grant by zone coordinators of exemptions from
requirements imposed by regulations made by virtue of  paragraph (a) ;

232.2.d

make provision imposing requirements on persons of a description specified in
the regulations for the purpose of securing that buildings of types specified
by the regulations situated within a heat network zone are installed with
communal heat networks—

232.2.d.i

in circumstances specified by the regulations,

232.2.d.ii

within a time specified by, or determined in accordance with, the regulations,
and

232.2.d.iii

in a manner that would allow the communal heat networks to be connected to a
district heat network;

232.2.e

make provision for, or in connection with, the requesting of information from
a person, by notice given by a zone coordinator, about a source of thermal
energy located on the person’s premises that may be suitable to supply a
district heat network within a heat network zone;

232.2.f

make provision for, or in connection with, the imposition of a requirement on
a person, by notice given by a zone coordinator, to allow the installation of
equipment on the person’s premises, and the connection of that equipment to a
district heat network, to enable a source of thermal energy located on the
premises to supply a district heat network within a heat network zone;

232.2.g

make provision imposing requirements on persons of a description specified in
the regulations for the purpose of securing that machinery and other equipment
of types specified by the regulations are designed, and installed on premises,
in a manner which would enable thermal energy generated by the machinery or
other equipment to be supplied to a district heat network within a heat
network zone;

232.2.h

make provision about the terms on which thermal energy is supplied to a
district heat network in pursuance of regulations made by virtue of  paragraph
(f)  or  (g)  (including in particular provision about the amount that may be
charged);

232.2.i

make provision for, or in connection with, the setting by zone coordinators of
limits on emissions of targeted greenhouse gases resulting from district heat
networks within heat network zones;

232.2.j

make provision about zone coordinators affording a grace period to a person
who is required to comply with a limit imposed under regulations made by
virtue of  paragraph (i) .

232.3

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (2) (c)  may—

232.3.a

specify the criteria in accordance with which a zone coordinator is to
determine an application for an exemption;

232.3.b

make provision about procedure;

232.3.c

specify how, and on what grounds, a refusal to grant an exemption may be
appealed.

232.4

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (2) (e)  may—

232.4.a

specify the information about the source of thermal energy that may be
requested;

232.4.b

require the requested information to be provided within the period, and in the
form and manner, specified in the notice;

232.4.c

provide for the disclosing of information requested by the zone coordinator
not to breach any obligation of confidence owed by the person making the
disclosure or any other restriction on the disclosure of information (however
imposed);

232.4.d

provide for a request for information not to require a disclosure of
information if disclosure would contravene the data protection legislation
(but for a requirement imposed by virtue of regulations made by virtue of
subsection (2) (e)  to be taken into account in determining whether a
disclosure would do so);

232.4.e

provide for zone coordinators to delegate functions conferred on them by
regulations made by virtue of  subsection (2) (e)  to a description of person,
and in circumstances and subject to conditions, specified by the regulations.

232.5

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (2) (f)  may—

232.5.a

specify the types of sources of thermal energy in respect of which a zone
coordinator may or must impose a requirement on a person and in what
circumstances;

232.5.b

make provision about the period within which a person must comply with a
requirement;

232.5.c

specify how, and on what grounds, a requirement imposed on a person in respect
of a source of thermal energy may be appealed.

232.6

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (2) (i)  may—

232.6.a

specify the manner and form in which the limits are to be set;

232.6.b

require zone coordinators to obtain the consent of the Authority before
setting a limit.

232.7

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (2) (j)  may—

232.7.a

specify the circumstances in which a zone coordinator may or must afford a
person a grace period;

232.7.b

make provision for the Authority to issue guidance about grace periods;

232.7.c

make provision about procedure;

232.7.d

specify how, and on what grounds, a refusal to grant a grace period may be
appealed.

232.8

In  subsection (2) (d) , “ communal heat network ” has the meaning given by
section 217 (2) .

232.9

In  subsection (2) (i) , “ emissions ” and “ targeted greenhouse gas ” have
the same meaning as in the Climate Change Act 2008 (see sections 24 and 97 of
that Act).

232.10

In  subsections (2) (j)  and  (7) , “ grace period ” means a period to comply
before enforcement action is taken.

###### Delivery of district heat networks within zones

233

233.1

Zones regulations may make provision about the delivery of district heat
networks within heat network zones.

233.2

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (1)  may, in particular—

233.2.a

make provision about zone coordinators deciding—

233.2.a.i

what district heat networks may be constructed and operated within a heat
network zone;

233.2.a.ii

who will design, construct, operate and maintain district heat networks within
heat network zones;

233.2.b

make provision about zone coordinators designing, constructing, operating or
maintaining district heat networks within heat network zones, or arranging for
their design, construction, operation or maintenance;

233.2.c

make provision about the giving of advice by the Authority to zone
coordinators about the delivery of district heat networks within heat network
zones.

233.3

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (2) (a) (ii)  may—

233.3.a

make provision for the construction, operation or maintenance of district heat
networks within heat network zones to be subject to the consent of zone
coordinators;

233.3.b

make provision for the grant by zone coordinators of an exclusive right to
design, construct, operate or maintain district heat networks within heat
network zones or parts of heat network zones.

233.4

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (3) (b)  may—

233.4.a

make provision for the Authority to publish the standard conditions that zone
coordinators must use when granting an exclusive right (and for the Authority
to amend or replace the standard conditions);

233.4.b

specify the circumstances in which zone coordinators may grant an exclusive
right.

233.5

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (2) (a)  may—

233.5.a

specify the manner and form of zone coordinators’ decisions under regulations
made by virtue of  subsection (2) (a) ;

233.5.b

make provision for a zone coordinator to vary or revoke a decision;

233.5.c

specify considerations a zone coordinator may or must take into account when
making, varying or revoking a decision;

233.5.d

make provision about procedure;

233.5.e

make provision about the publication of a decision (or the variation or
revocation of a decision);

233.5.f

specify how, and on what grounds, a decision, or a variation or revocation of
a decision, may be appealed;

233.5.g

make provision for a zone coordinator to lose the power to decide the matters
specified in  subsection (2) (a) (i)  and  (ii) , and instead for those
matters to no longer be subject to the zone coordinator’s control, if the zone
coordinator does not take steps specified by the regulations within a time
specified by the regulations.

##### Enforcement

###### Enforcement of heat network zone requirements

234

234.1

Zones regulations may make provision about the enforcement of heat network
zone requirements.

234.2

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (1)  may, in particular, provide for
a zone coordinator—

234.2.a

to issue a notice requiring a person to demonstrate compliance with a heat
network zone requirement where the zone coordinator suspects that the person
is not complying with the requirement;

234.2.b

to issue a notice specifying steps a person is required to take in order to
comply with a heat network zone requirement where the zone coordinator is
satisfied that the person is not complying with the requirement;

234.2.c

to impose a penalty on a person for the contravention of—

234.2.c.i

a heat network zone requirement, or

234.2.c.ii

a requirement imposed by a notice under regulations made by virtue of
paragraph (a)  or  (b) .

234.3

Regulations made by virtue of  subsection (2) (a)  or  (b)  may—

234.3.a

make provision about the period within which a person must comply with a
notice;

234.3.b

make provision about procedure;

234.3.c

specify how, and on what grounds, a notice may be appealed.

234.4

In  this section , “ heat network zone requirement ” means a requirement
imposed by or by virtue of regulations made by virtue of  section 232  or  233
.

235.1

Zones regulations made by virtue of  section 231 (2) (c)  or  234 (2) (c)

235.1.a

235.1.b

make provision about procedure;

235.1.c

specify how a penalty may be recovered;

235.1.d

require sums received by way of penalty to be paid into the Consolidated Fund
or to persons specified by the regulations.

235.2

Zones regulations made by virtue of  section 231 (2) (c)  or  234 (2) (c)
must include provision for a right of appeal against the imposition of a
penalty.

235.3

Zones regulations may provide for the publication of guidance by the Authority
with respect to—

235.3.a

the imposition of penalties under regulations made by virtue of  section 231
(2) (c)  or  234 (2) (c) , and

235.3.b

the determination of their amount.

##### Records, information and reporting

###### Records, information and reporting

236

236.1

Zones regulations may make provision requiring zone coordinators to collect
information specified by the regulations which—

236.1.a

is relevant to identifying areas which are appropriate for the construction
and operation of one or more district heat networks, or

236.1.b

relates to areas designated as heat network zones.

236.2

Zones regulations may make provision requiring zone coordinators to maintain
records of—

236.2.a

information provided to zone coordinators in response to requests for
information made by zone coordinators under regulations made by virtue of
section 231  or  232 (2) (e) ;

236.2.b

information zone coordinators are required to collect by regulations made by
virtue of  subsection (1)  of this section;

236.2.c

other information provided to, collected by, or otherwise brought into the
possession of zone coordinators by virtue of their functions under zones
regulations.

236.3

Zones regulations may make provision enabling or requiring zone coordinators
to provide information specified by the regulations from their records to—

236.3.a

to other zone coordinators;

236.3.b

the Authority;

236.3.c

the Regulator.

236.4

Zone regulations may require the Authority to maintain records of—

236.4.a

information provided to the Authority in response to requests for information
made by the Authority under regulations made by virtue of  section 231 ;

236.4.b

information provided by zone coordinators to the Authority in accordance with
regulations made by virtue of  subsection (3)  of  this section ;

236.4.c

other information provided to, collected by, or otherwise brought into the
possession of the Authority by virtue of its functions under zones
regulations.

236.5

Zones regulations may make provision enabling or requiring the Authority to
provide information specified by the regulations from its records to—

236.5.a

zone coordinators;

236.5.b

the Regulator.

236.6

Zones regulations may make provision—

236.6.a

for the disclosure of information by a zone coordinator or the Authority in
accordance with regulations made by virtue of  subsection (3)  or  (5)  not to
breach any obligation of confidence owed by the zone coordinator or the
Authority or any other restriction on the disclosure of information (however
imposed);

236.6.b

for regulations made by virtue of  subsection (3)  or  (5)  not to authorise
or require disclosure of information if disclosure would contravene the data
protection legislation (but for a power conferred, or requirement imposed, by
regulations made by virtue of  subsection (3)  or  (5)  to be taken into
account in determining whether a disclosure would do so).

##### Interpretation

###### Interpretation of Chapter 2

237

In this Chapter—

      “ the Authority ” means the person designated as the Heat Network Zones
Authority by regulations made by virtue of  section 227 (1) ;           “ the
data protection legislation ” has the same meaning as in the Data Protection
Act 2018 (see section 3 of that Act);           “ district heat network ” has
the meaning given by  section 216 (2) ;           “ heat network ” has the
meaning given by  section 216 (2) ;           “ heat network zone ” has the
meaning given by  section 226 (2) ;           “ the Regulator ” has the
meaning given by  section 217 (1) (a) ;           “ zone coordinator ” means a
person designated as such under regulations made by virtue of  section 228 (3)
(a) ;           “ zones regulations ” means regulations under  section 226 ;
“ the zoning methodology ” has the meaning given by  section 230 (1) .

### Energy smart appliances and load control

#### Introductory

##### Energy smart appliances and load control

238

238.1

The following definitions apply for the purposes of  this Part .

238.2

“ Energy smart appliance ” means an appliance which is capable of adjusting
the immediate or future flow of electricity into or out of itself or another
appliance in response to a load control signal; and includes any software or
other systems which enable or facilitate the adjustment to be made in response
to the signal.

238.3

The functionality described in  subsection (2)  is referred to as the “ energy
smart function ”.

238.4

“ Load control signal ” means a digital communication sent via a relevant
electronic communications network to an energy smart appliance for the purpose
of causing or otherwise facilitating such an adjustment.

238.5

For the purposes of subsection (2) an adjustment to the flow of electricity
into or out of an appliance is made in response to a load control signal
whether it is made in response to—

238.5.a

the sending of the signal, or

238.5.b

the sending of the signal and one or more additional factors.

238.6

The sending of a load control signal to an energy smart appliance is referred
to as “ load control ”.

238.7

Regulations under  section 239 , excluding regulations under  section 239 (6)
, are referred to as “ energy smart regulations ”.

#### Energy smart appliances

##### Energy smart regulations

239

239.1

The Secretary of State may by regulations make provision about energy smart
appliances that are—

239.1.a

capable of being used in connection with any of the purposes specified in
subsection (2) , or

239.1.b

charge points (for electric vehicles).

239.2

The specified purposes are—

239.2.a

refrigeration;

239.2.b

cleaning tableware;

239.2.c

washing or drying textiles;

239.2.d

storing energy that—

239.2.d.i

was converted from electricity, and

239.2.d.ii

is stored for the purpose of its future reconversion into electricity;

239.2.e

heating;

239.2.f

air conditioning or ventilation.

239.3

In making such regulations, the Secretary of State must, in particular, have
regard to the desirability of ensuring that—

239.3.a

the energy smart function or compatibility with that function is incorporated
into appliances in a manner that is compliant with the regulations,

239.3.b

the energy smart function does not undermine the delivery of a consistent and
stable supply of electricity,

239.3.c

the energy smart function in any energy smart appliance is capable of
operating in response to load control signals from any person carrying out
load control, and

239.3.d

communications, software, systems and personal and other data used in
connection with energy smart appliances are secure or otherwise protected, for
purposes including the protection of end-users.

239.4

Such regulations may, in particular—

239.4.a

make provision about all energy smart appliances or any description of energy
smart appliances;

239.4.b

impose technical or other requirements in relation to such appliances,
including requirements to display or otherwise provide information about
appliances;

239.4.c

prohibit the placing on the market of, or other activities in connection with,
relevant appliances (see  section 240 (3) );

239.4.d

make provision about the recall of appliances to prevent, or in response to,
non-compliance with the regulations;

239.4.e

make provision for the Secretary of State to issue guidance about prohibitions
or requirements imposed by or under the regulations;

239.4.f

provide for the enforcement of the regulations.

239.5

Such regulations may impose prohibitions or requirements on any person,
including any person making, supplying, importing or distributing energy smart
appliances or carrying out load control (but see  section 240 (6) ).

239.6

The Secretary of State may by regulations—

239.6.a

make provision about the meaning that “relevant electronic communications
network” is to have for the purposes of  this Part ;

239.6.b

amend the list of purposes in  subsection (2) .

239.7

In  this Chapter , “ charge point ” has the same meaning as in Part 2 of the
Automated and Electric Vehicles Act 2018 (see section 9 of that Act).

##### Prohibitions and requirements: supplemental

240

240.1

Requirements imposed by energy smart regulations may, in particular, refer or
relate to—

240.1.a

published documents and standards (as they have effect from time to time);

240.1.b

a list, published by the Secretary of State, of such documents and standards;

240.1.c

requirements (however described) imposed by or under any enactment or Act of
the Scottish Parliament.

240.2

Prohibitions imposed by energy smart regulations may, in particular, relate
to—

240.2.a

the providing of load control for appliances that are not compliant with the
regulations;

240.2.b

the modification of appliances in a manner that would cause them to cease to
be compliant with the regulations.

240.3

The following kinds of appliances are “ relevant appliances ” for the purposes
of  section 239 (4) (c) —

240.3.a

energy smart appliances that are not compliant with requirements or particular
requirements of energy smart regulations;

240.3.b

appliances without the energy smart function, or that are not compatible with
the energy smart function of another appliance, and are—

240.3.b.i

charge points (for electric vehicles), or

240.3.b.ii

electrical heating appliances.

240.4

The reference in  subsection (3) (b) (ii)  to electrical heating appliances
includes a reference to heat pumps.

240.5

In  this Chapter , “ modification of appliances ” has the meaning given by
energy smart regulations.

240.6

Energy smart regulations may not provide for a prohibition to be contravened
by an end-user of an appliance (in their capacity as such) or for such a
person to be enforced against as described in  section 241  or  242 .

##### Enforcement

241

241.1

Provision for the enforcement of energy smart regulations may, in particular,
include provision of a kind described in  this section ,  section 242  or
section 243 .

241.2

Energy smart regulations may include provision to ensure compliance with any
prohibition or requirement imposed by or under the regulations, including
provision—

241.2.a

designating authorities to carry out enforcement (referred to in  this Chapter
as “enforcement authorities”);

241.2.b

requiring persons to—

241.2.b.i

maintain information;

241.2.b.ii

monitor compliance and report non-compliance;

241.2.b.iii

take specified steps to remedy non-compliance;

241.2.c

requiring persons to supply evidence of their compliance to enforcement
authorities;

241.2.d

conferring powers of entry, including by reasonable force;

241.2.e

conferring powers of inspection, search and seizure;

241.2.f

conferring powers to require the production of information or things held at,
or electronically accessible from, entered premises;

241.2.g

conferring powers to enable the testing of energy smart appliances by
enforcement authorities, including powers to require the provision of sample
appliances and powers to make test purchases;

241.2.h

conferring functions, including functions involving the exercise of a
discretion.

241.3

Regulations conferring powers described in  subsection (2) (d) ,  (e)  or  (f)
must provide that persons exercising those powers are to produce evidence of
their authority if required to do so.

241.4

The regulations may not allow entry to premises by reasonable force without a
warrant issued by a justice of the peace or, in Scotland, a sheriff or summary
sheriff.

241.5

Energy smart regulations may allow enforcement authorities to impose
requirements by written notice on persons to—

241.5.a

produce information or things;

241.5.b

make appliances compliant with energy smart regulations;

241.5.c

stop or limit—

241.5.c.i

the placing on the market of, or other activities in connection with,
appliances,

241.5.c.ii

the providing of load control to appliances, or

241.5.c.iii

the modification of appliances,

for the purpose of preventing or mitigating non-compliance with energy smart
regulations;

241.5.d

recall appliances to prevent, or in response to, non-compliance with energy
smart regulations.

241.6

Regulations that allow an enforcement authority to impose requirements may
also provide for—

241.6.a

the authority to apply to a court or tribunal in connection with a failure to
comply with a requirement, and

241.6.b

the court or tribunal, if satisfied that such a failure has occurred, to make
an order for the purpose of securing compliance with the requirement.

241.7

Such an order may require a person to take, or refrain from taking, steps
specified in the order (including at, by or until specified times).

241.8

Energy smart regulations may make provision to enable an enforcement authority
to accept an enforcement undertaking from a person where the authority has
reasonable grounds to suspect that the person has failed to comply with any
prohibition or requirement imposed by or under the regulations.

241.9

An “enforcement undertaking” is an undertaking to take such action to secure
compliance with the regulations as may be specified in the undertaking within
such period as may be so specified.

241.10

Provision made by virtue of  subsection (8)  must include provision that
unless the person from whom the undertaking was accepted has failed to comply
with the undertaking or any part of it—

241.10.a

that person may not at any time be convicted of an offence in respect of the
act or omission to which the undertaking relates, and

241.10.b

the enforcement authority may not impose on that person any penalty which it
would otherwise have power to impose under the regulations in respect of that
act or omission.

241.11

Provision made by virtue of  subsection (8)  may include any provision of a
kind mentioned in section 50(5) of the Regulatory Enforcement and Sanctions
Act 2008.

241.12

The Secretary of State may make payments or provide other resources to, or in
respect of, enforcement authorities in connection with the exercise of
functions under energy smart regulations.

241.13

Energy smart regulations may provide for an enforcement authority to issue
guidance about the enforcement of the regulations and the exercise by the
authority of its functions under the regulations.

##### Sanctions, offences and recovery of costs

242

242.1

Energy smart regulations may provide for sanctions to be imposed on persons in
relation to—

242.1.a

non-compliance with a prohibition or requirement imposed by or under such
regulations;

242.1.b

providing false or misleading information in relation to any such prohibition
or requirement.

242.2

The regulations may, in particular, provide for the imposition of civil
penalties, including graduated or multiple penalties in connection with a
continuous or serious act or omission.

242.3

Energy smart regulations may create offences relating to—

242.3.a

contraventions (by act or omission) of requirements imposed by enforcement
authorities;

242.3.b

knowingly giving false or misleading information to enforcement authorities;

242.3.c

the obstruction (by act or omission) of persons acting on behalf of
enforcement authorities;

242.3.d

the impersonation of persons acting on behalf of enforcement authorities.

242.4

Regulations which create an offence must provide for the offence to be triable
only summarily.

242.5

Regulations may not provide for an offence to be punishable with imprisonment.

242.6

Regulations may provide for enforcement authorities to recover costs.

##### Appeals against enforcement action

243

243.1

Energy smart regulations that provide for the imposition of a requirement or
civil penalty by an enforcement authority must include provision for a right
of appeal to a court or tribunal against that requirement or penalty.

243.2

Provision falling within  subsection (1)  includes, in particular, provision—

243.2.a

as to the jurisdiction of the court or tribunal to which an appeal may be
made;

243.2.b

as to the grounds on which an appeal may be made;

243.2.c

as to the procedure for making an appeal (including any fee which may be
payable);

243.2.d

suspending the imposition of the requirement or penalty, pending determination
of the appeal;

243.2.e

as to the powers of the court or tribunal to which an appeal is made;

243.2.f

as to how any sum payable in pursuance of a decision of the court or tribunal
is to be recoverable.

243.3

In relation to the imposition of a requirement, the regulations may provide
for persons other than the person against whom the requirement was imposed to
also have a right of appeal.

243.4

The provision referred to in  subsection (2) (e)  includes provision
conferring on the court or tribunal to which an appeal is made power—

243.4.a

to confirm or withdraw the requirement or penalty;

243.4.b

to vary or remove a part of the requirement;

243.4.c

to vary the amount of the penalty;

243.4.d

to award costs or, in Scotland, expenses.

243.5

If the Secretary of State considers it appropriate for the purpose of, or in
consequence of, any provision falling within  subsection (2) (a) ,  (c) ,  (e)
or  (f) , the regulations may revoke or amend any subordinate legislation.

243.6

In  this section  “ subordinate legislation ” has the meaning given in section
21(1) of the Interpretation Act 1978 and includes an instrument made under—

243.6.a

an Act of the Scottish Parliament;

243.6.b

a Measure or Act of the Senedd Cymru.

##### Regulations: procedure and supplemental

244

244.1

Regulations under  section 239  may provide for exemptions or exceptions.

244.2

Energy smart regulations may make provision about the sharing of information
between an enforcement authority and the GEMA for the purposes of their
functions in relation to energy smart appliances and load control.

244.3

The Secretary of State must consult such persons as the Secretary of State
thinks fit before making regulations under  section 239  that—

244.3.a

make a description of appliance subject to energy smart regulations;

244.3.b

amend the list of purposes in  section 239 (2) .

244.4

Subsection (3)  may be satisfied by consultation before, as well as by
consultation after, the passing of this Act.

244.5

The first energy smart regulations, and any regulations under  section 239
that (with or without other provision) amend the list of purposes in  section
239 (2)  or create a criminal offence (see  section 242 ), are subject to the
affirmative procedure.

244.6

Energy smart regulations that are not within subsection  (5)  are subject to
the made affirmative procedure if they—

244.6.a

are the first energy smart regulations to make provision about a particular
description of energy smart appliance,

244.6.b

make provision by virtue of  section 239 (4) (b)  imposing requirements of a
kind not previously imposed by energy smart regulations,

244.6.c

make provision by virtue of  section 240 (1) (a)  or (b) by reference or in
relation to a published document, standard or list (as the case may be) in
respect of which such provision has not previously been made,

244.6.d

confer new powers for the enforcement of energy smart regulations, or

244.6.e

make provision by virtue of  section 242 (2)  for the imposition of new civil
penalties.

244.7

A revised version of a published document, standard or list is to be
disregarded for the purposes of  subsection (6) (c)  if provision has
previously been made in respect of the document, standard or list by virtue of
section 240 (1) (a)  or (b) (as the case may be).

244.8

Any other regulations under  section 239  are subject to the negative
procedure.

#### Licensing of load control

##### Power to amend licence conditions etc: load control

245

245.1

The Secretary of State may modify—

245.1.a

the conditions of a licence granted under section 6(1) of the Electricity Act
1989;

245.1.b

the standard conditions incorporated in such licences by virtue of section 8A
of that Act;

245.1.c

the conditions of a licence granted under section 7A(1) or 7AB of the Gas Act
1986;

245.1.d

the standard conditions incorporated in such licences by virtue of section 8
of that Act;

245.1.e

a document maintained in accordance with the conditions of a licence granted
under section 6(1) of the Electricity Act 1989 or section 7A(1) or 7AB of the
Gas Act 1986, or an agreement that gives effect to a document so maintained.

245.2

The Secretary of State may exercise the power conferred by subsection  (1)
for the purposes of facilitating, promoting, ensuring the security of, or
otherwise regulating load control or other activities falling within section
56FBA(2) of the Electricity Act 1989.

245.3

Modifications made to the conditions of a licence may include provisions of a
kind mentioned in section 7 of the Electricity Act 1989 or section 7B of the
Gas Act 1986 (as appropriate) and may in particular—

245.3.a

regulate or prohibit the provision of load control in relation to appliances
that are not compliant with energy smart regulations or any technical
standards specified in or under a condition;

245.3.b

regulate the provision of load control in relation to appliances that are
compliant with energy smart regulations or any technical standards specified
in or under a condition;

245.3.c

require the holder of a licence to supply information to the Secretary of
State or the GEMA (or both) so as to enable them to assess any matter relating
to the purposes mentioned in subsection  (2) ;

245.3.d

require the holder of the licence to enter (or refrain from entering) into an
agreement of a specified kind, or with a specified person;

245.3.e

require the holder of a licence to supply information about tariffs (including
to such persons, and in such a format, specified in or under a condition).

245.4

The power conferred by subsection  (1) —

245.4.a

may be exercised to make different provision in relation to different areas or
different classes of customer;

245.4.b

may be exercised generally, only in relation to specified cases or subject to
exceptions (including provision for a case to be excepted only so long as
specified conditions are satisfied);

245.4.c

may be exercised differently in different cases or circumstances;

245.4.d

includes a power to make incidental, supplementary, consequential or
transitional modifications.

245.5

The power conferred by subsection  (1)  may not be exercised after the period
of 10 years beginning with the day on which  this section  comes into force.

245.6

The Secretary of State may, by regulations, extend (or further extend) that
period.

245.7

Regulations under  subsection (6) —

245.7.a

may not extend the period (or any extended period) by more than three years at
a time, and

245.7.b

are subject to the affirmative procedure.

245.8

In  this section  “ modify ” includes remove or fail to incorporate and “
modification ” is to be construed accordingly.

##### Power to amend licence conditions etc: procedure

246

246.1

Before making a modification, the Secretary of State must consult—

246.1.a

the holder of any licence being modified,

246.1.b

the GEMA, and

246.1.c

such other persons as the Secretary of State considers appropriate.

246.2

Subsection  (1)  may be satisfied by consultation before, as well as by
consultation after, the passing of this Act.

246.3

The Secretary of State must specify the date upon which any modification is to
have effect.

246.4

The Secretary of State must publish details of any modifications as soon as
reasonably practicable after they are made.

246.5

In  this section  “ modification ” means a modification under  section 245 .

##### Load control: supplemental

247

247.1

A modification under  section 245  of part of a standard condition of a
licence does not prevent any other part of the condition from continuing to be
regarded as a standard condition for the purposes of Part 1 of the Gas Act
1986 or Part 1 of the Electricity Act 1989.

247.2

Where the Secretary of State makes modifications under  section 245 (1) (b)
or  (e)  of the standard conditions of a licence of any type, the GEMA must—

247.2.a

make the same modification of those standard conditions for the purposes of
their incorporation in licences of that type granted after that time, and

247.2.b

publish the modification.

##### Application of general duties to functions relating to load control

248

248.1

Sections 4AA to 4B of the Gas Act 1986 (principal objectives and general
duties) apply to the carrying out, as respects the matters mentioned in
subsection (2) , of functions conferred on the Secretary of State or the GEMA
by or under sections  245  to  247 .

248.2

The matters are—

248.2.a

activities required to be authorised by gas licences,

248.2.b

such licences and the conditions of such licences,

248.2.c

documents maintained in accordance with the conditions of such licences, or
agreements that give effect to documents so maintained, and

248.2.d

companies holding such licences.

248.3

In section 4AA(2)(b) of the Gas Act 1986 (duty to have regard to ability of
licence holders to finance obligations) for “or sections 26 to 29 of the
Energy Act 2010” substitute  “, sections 26 to 29 of the Energy Act 2010, or
sections  245  to  247  of the Energy Act 2023” .

248.4

Sections 3A to 3D of the Electricity Act 1989 (principal objectives and
general duties) apply to the carrying out, as respects the matters mentioned
in  subsection (5) , of functions conferred on the Secretary of State or the
GEMA by or under sections  245  to  247 .

248.5

The matters are—

248.5.a

activities required to be authorised by electricity licences,

248.5.b

such licences and the conditions of such licences,

248.5.c

documents maintained in accordance with the conditions of such licences, or
agreements that give effect to documents so maintained, and

248.5.d

companies holding such licences.

248.6

In section 3A(2)(b) of the Electricity Act 1989 (duty to have regard to
ability of licence holders to finance obligations) for “or the Nuclear Energy
(Financing) Act 2022” substitute  “, the Nuclear Energy (Financing) Act 2022
or sections  245  to  247  of the Energy Act 2023” .

248.7

In section 33(1) of the Utilities Act 2000 (standard conditions of electricity
licences)—

248.7.a

omit the “or” at the end of paragraph (i), and

248.7.b

after paragraph (j) insert

or,

248.7.b.k

under sections  245  to  247  of the Energy Act 2023.

248.8

In  this section —

      “ electricity licence ” means a licence for the purposes of section 4 of
the Electricity Act 1989 (prohibition on unlicensed activities);           “
gas licence ” means a licence for the purposes of section 5 of the Gas Act
1986 (prohibition on unlicensed activities).

##### Licensing of activities relating to load control

249

Schedule 19 , which amends the Electricity Act 1989, provides for the
licensing of load control.

### Energy performance of premises

#### Power to make energy performance regulations

250

250.1

The appropriate authority may make regulations for any of these purposes—

250.1.a

enabling or requiring the energy usage or energy efficiency of premises to be
assessed, certified and publicised;

250.1.b

enabling or requiring possible improvements in the energy usage or energy
efficiency of premises to be identified and recommended;

250.1.c

restricting or prohibiting the marketing and disposal of premises on the basis
of whether their energy usage or energy efficiency has been assessed,
certified or publicised.

250.2

In this Part regulations under  this section  are referred to as “ energy
performance regulations ”.

250.3

Energy performance regulations may—

250.3.a

provide for—

250.3.a.i

the regulations to apply to specified descriptions of premises, or

250.3.a.ii

specified descriptions of premises to be excluded from the application of the
regulations;

250.3.b

confer functions on any person;

250.3.c

provide for functions to be exercisable only if specified conditions are met
(including conditions as to the eligibility of persons to exercise the
functions);

250.3.d

provide for the energy usage or energy efficiency of premises to be assessed
or certified by reference to information that is obtained, produced or kept
otherwise than under energy performance regulations;

250.3.e

impose requirements on any person;

250.3.f

make provision for the purpose of securing compliance with requirements
imposed by or under energy performance regulations (see  section 252 );

250.3.g

authorise or require, or restrict or prohibit, the supply or keeping of
information (including authorising or requiring supply or keeping of
information that would otherwise be prohibited);

250.3.h

provide for the charging of fees.

250.4

A reference in this Part to publicising the energy usage and energy efficiency
of premises includes—

250.4.a

displaying energy performance information in the premises to which it relates;

250.4.b

arranging for energy performance information to be entered into a record of
such information (including a record that is publicly accessible);

250.4.c

reporting energy performance information;

250.4.d

supplying energy performance information.

250.5

In this Part—

      “ the appropriate authority ” means—         in relation to England and
Wales, the Secretary of State;           in relation to Scotland, the Scottish
Ministers;           in relation to Northern Ireland, the Department;
“ certified ” means certified in accordance with energy performance
regulations;           “ the Department ” means the Department of Finance in
Northern Ireland;           “ disposal of premises ” includes leasing or
letting of premises;           “ energy performance information ” means
information about the energy usage or energy efficiency of premises;
“ premises ” means—         a building or a part of a building (including any
equipment, systems or facilities used by the building or the part), or
any equipment, systems or facilities used by a building or a part of a
building;                 “ specified ” means specified in energy performance
regulations.

#### Energy performance regulations relating to new premises

251

251.1

The power to make energy performance regulations is exercisable in relation to
new premises.

251.2

Accordingly, in  section 250  (except in the definition of “premises” in
section 250 (5) )—

251.2.a

a reference to premises includes new premises;

251.2.b

a reference to the energy usage and energy efficiency of premises includes the
anticipated energy usage and energy efficiency of new premises.

251.3

In  this section  “ new premises ” means premises—

251.3.a

which are being constructed or adapted, or

251.3.b

which it is proposed to construct or adapt.

#### Sanctions

252

252.1

The enforcement provision that may be made includes provision—

252.1.a

for a person with public functions to enforce a requirement imposed by or
under energy performance regulations;

252.1.b

about the sanctions for non-compliance with a requirement imposed by or under
energy performance regulations;

252.1.c

about the sanctions for the provision of false information in connection with
such a requirement;

252.1.d

about the sanctions for obstruction of, or impersonation of, an enforcement
authority or a person acting for an enforcement authority.

252.2

Energy performance regulations may provide for the imposition of civil
penalties by enforcement authorities in relation to cases falling within
subsection (1) (b) ,  (c)  or  (d) ; but the regulations may not provide for a
civil penalty that exceeds £15,000.

252.3

Energy performance regulations may provide for the creation of criminal
offences in relation to cases falling within subsection (1)(b), (c) or (d);
but the regulations may not provide for a criminal offence to be punishable—

252.3.a

with imprisonment for a term exceeding 12 months, or

252.3.b

with a fine of more than level 5 on the standard scale.

252.4

Where energy performance regulations make provision for a civil penalty, the
regulations must also include provision for a right of appeal to a court or
tribunal against the imposition of the penalty.

252.5

Provision falling within  subsection (4)  includes, in particular, provision—

252.5.a

as to the jurisdiction of the court or tribunal to which an appeal may be
made;

252.5.b

as to the grounds on which an appeal may be made;

252.5.c

as to the procedure for making an appeal (including any fee which may be
payable);

252.5.d

suspending the imposition of the penalty, pending determination of the appeal;

252.5.e

as to the powers of the court or tribunal to which an appeal is made;

252.5.f

as to how any sum payable in pursuance of a decision of the court or tribunal
is to be recoverable.

252.6

The provision referred to in  subsection (5) (e)  includes provision
conferring on the court or tribunal to which an appeal is made power—

252.6.a

to confirm the penalty;

252.6.b

to withdraw the penalty;

252.6.c

to vary the amount of the penalty;

252.6.d

to award costs.

252.7

The appropriate authority may, by regulations, amend the amount specified in
subsection (2) for the purpose of reflecting inflation.

252.8

In  this section —

      “ enforcement authority ” means a person on whom energy performance
regulations confer the function of enforcing any requirement imposed by or
under energy performance regulations;           “ enforcement provision ”
means provision falling within  section 250 (3) (f) .

#### Regulations under 

253

253.1

Regulations under this Part may amend, repeal or revoke provision made by or
under primary legislation.

253.2

Regulations under this Part containing provision within subsection  (3)  (with
or without other provision)—

253.2.a

if made by the Secretary of State, are subject to the affirmative procedure
(see  section 332 );

253.2.b

if made by the Scottish Ministers, are subject to the affirmative procedure
(see section 29 of the Interpretation and Legislative Reform (Scotland) Act
2010 (asp 10) );

253.2.c

if made by the Department, may not be made unless a draft of the regulations
has been laid before and approved by a resolution of the Northern Ireland
Assembly.

253.3

The provision within this subsection is—

253.3.a

provision creating a criminal offence or civil penalty (but excluding
provision modifying the circumstances in which a person is guilty of an
existing offence or liable for an existing civil penalty);

253.3.b

provision specifying a civil penalty amount (but excluding provision made by
virtue of  section 252 (7)  (inflation-related adjustments));

253.3.c

provision amending or repealing provision made by primary legislation.

253.4

Any other regulations under this Part—

253.4.a

if made by the Secretary of State, are subject to the negative procedure (see
section 332 );

253.4.b

if made by the Scottish Ministers, are subject to the negative procedure (see
section 28 of the Interpretation and Legislative Reform (Scotland) Act  2010
(asp 10) );

253.4.c

if made by the Department, are subject to negative resolution within the
meaning given by section 41(6) of the Interpretation Act (Northern Ireland)
1954 (c. 33 (N.I.)) .

253.5

Regulations under this Part—

253.5.a

may make provision about application to the Crown; and

253.5.b

may also, to the extent that they bind the Crown, restrict or modify the
application of the regulations.

253.6

A power of the Department to make regulations under this Part is exercisable
by statutory rule for the purposes of the Statutory Rules (Northern Ireland)
Order 1979 ( S.I. 1979/1573 (N.I. 12)) .

253.7

In this section “ primary legislation ” means—

253.7.a

an Act of Parliament,

253.7.b

an Act of the Scottish Parliament,

253.7.c

an Act or Measure of Senedd Cymru, or

253.7.d

Northern Ireland legislation.

### Energy Savings Opportunity Schemes

#### Establishment and application of schemes

##### Energy savings opportunity schemes

254

254.1

The Secretary of State may by regulations (“ ESOS regulations ”) make
provision for the establishment and operation of one or more energy savings
opportunity schemes.

254.2

An “energy savings opportunity scheme” is a scheme under which obligations are
imposed on undertakings to which the scheme applies for one or more of the
ESOS purposes.

254.3

The ESOS purposes are—

254.3.a

enabling or requiring the energy consumption for which an undertaking is
responsible, or the greenhouse gas emissions resulting from that consumption,
to be assessed, audited, reported and published;

254.3.b

enabling or requiring possible energy savings or emissions reductions to be
identified and recommended;

254.3.c

enabling or requiring the costs and benefits of possible energy savings or
emissions reductions to be assessed;

254.3.d

encouraging or requiring undertakings to produce plans or set targets for
achieving energy savings or emissions reductions;

254.3.e

encouraging or requiring undertakings to take action for the purpose of
achieving energy savings or emissions reductions;

254.3.f

encouraging or requiring undertakings to achieve energy savings or emissions
reductions.

254.4

An energy saving is a reduction in the energy consumption for which an
undertaking is responsible.

254.5

An emissions reduction is a reduction in the greenhouse gas emissions that
result from the energy consumption for which an undertaking is responsible
(whether or not that consumption is also reduced).

254.6

ESOS regulations may make provision about determining—

254.6.a

the energy consumption for which an undertaking is responsible;

254.6.b

the greenhouse gas emissions resulting from that consumption.

254.7

ESOS regulations may—

254.7.a

impose requirements on any person;

254.7.b

confer functions on any person;

254.7.c

provide for a person to exercise discretion in dealing with any matter.

254.8

The provision made by this Part is without prejudice to the generality of
subsection  (1) .

254.9

For the purposes of this Part—

254.9.a

the scheme established by the Energy Savings Opportunity Scheme Regulations
2014 ( S.I. 2014/1643 ) is to be treated as having been established by
provision made under  subsection (1) ;

254.9.b

a reference to a scheme administrator includes a reference to a compliance
body within the meaning given by those Regulations.

##### Application of energy savings opportunity schemes

255

255.1

ESOS regulations may provide for—

255.1.a

an energy savings opportunity scheme to apply to specified descriptions of
undertakings;

255.1.b

specified descriptions of undertakings to be excluded from the application of
the scheme.

255.2

ESOS regulations may make provision about circumstances in which—

255.2.a

two or more participants are to be treated for the purposes of the regulations
as if they were a single participant;

255.2.b

an obligation imposed under the regulations on one participant is to be
treated as if it had been imposed on a different participant.

255.3

The provisions of this Part relating to energy consumption apply to energy
consumed by assets located, or activities carried on—

255.3.a

wholly or partly in the United Kingdom;

255.3.b

wholly or partly in an offshore area;

255.3.c

where  subsection (4)  applies, elsewhere.

255.4

ESOS regulations may make provision about circumstances in which the energy
consumption for which a participant is, for the purposes of the regulations,
