measures in or in relation to the Scottish inshore region, where the provision
is made by or under an Act of the Scottish Parliament;

293.5.c

in the case of regulations made by the Welsh Ministers—

293.5.c.i

section 126 of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009;

293.5.c.ii

regulations 9 and 10 and Part 6 of the Conservation of Habitats and Species
Regulations 2017 ( S.I. 2017/1012 );

293.5.c.iii

any other provision that relates to the taking or securing of compensatory
measures, where the provision is made by or under an Act or Measure of Senedd
Cymru;

293.5.d

in the case of regulations made by DAERA—

293.5.d.i

section 23 of the Marine Act (Northern Ireland) 2013;

293.5.d.ii

regulations 3 and 3A and Part 4 of the Conservation (Natural Habitats, etc.)
Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1995 ( S.R. (N.I.) 1995 No. 380 );

293.5.d.iii

any other provision that relates to the taking or securing of compensatory
measures in or in relation to the Northern Ireland inshore region, where the
provision is made by or under Northern Ireland legislation.

293.6

But regulations under this section may not disapply or otherwise modify, or
make provision which could undermine or circumvent—

293.6.a

section 126(7)(a) or (b) of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009, section
83(4)(b)(i) or (ii) of the Marine (Scotland) Act 2010 or section 23(7)(a) or
(b) of the Marine Act (Northern Ireland) 2013,

293.6.b

regulation 64 of the Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017,

293.6.c

regulation 29 of the Conservation of Offshore Marine Habitats and Species
Regulations 2017,

293.6.d

regulation 49 of the Conservation (Natural Habitats, &c.) Regulations 1994,

293.6.e

regulation 44 of the Conservation (Natural Habitats, etc.) Regulations
(Northern Ireland) 1995, or

293.6.f

any provision about qualifying Secretary of State functions (unless the
regulations are made by the Secretary of State).

293.7

Regulations made under this section by the Secretary of State—

293.7.a

may not provide for a function that is exercisable by a Scottish public
authority, a Welsh public authority or a Northern Ireland public authority to
cease to be exercisable by that authority, and

293.7.b

to the extent that a function is exercisable by or on behalf of a Scottish
public authority, a Welsh public authority or a Northern Ireland public
authority, may not provide for the function also to be exercisable to that
extent by another person,

but may (subject to paragraphs  (a)  and  (b) ) modify such a function.

293.8

Regulations under this section may make provision—

293.8.a

enabling the appropriate authority or a specified person to direct a person to
take steps or to refrain from taking steps;

293.8.b

requiring a person given such a direction to comply with it.

293.9

But regulations made by the Secretary of State by virtue of subsection  (8)
(a)  may not enable directions to be given—

293.9.a

to a Scottish public authority by a person other than the Scottish Ministers;

293.9.b

to a Welsh public authority by a person other than the Welsh Ministers.

293.10

Regulations under this section may require the appropriate authority or a
specified person—

293.10.a

to give guidance about specified matters;

293.10.b

to consult specified persons, or persons of a specified description, before
giving guidance by virtue of  paragraph (a) .

293.11

Regulations under this section may confer functions, including functions
involving the exercise of a discretion—

293.11.a

in the case of regulations made by the Secretary State, on any person;

293.11.b

in any other case, on a person other than a Minister of the Crown.

293.12

The functions that may be conferred on a person by virtue of subsection  (11)
include a function of giving advice in relation to the application or exercise
of any other function, whether exercisable by that or another person, under or
by virtue of regulations under this section.

293.13

In this section—

      “ protected site ” has the meaning determined in accordance with
regulations under this section; and those regulations—         must be framed
so that protected sites consist of natural habitats or habitats of species,
and           must in particular include protected marine areas;
“ qualifying Secretary of State functions ” means functions of the Secretary
of State in relation to relevant offshore wind activities in (as the case may
be) the Welsh inshore region or the Northern Ireland inshore region;
“ specified ” means specified in regulations under this section.

294.11

##### Interpretation of Chapter 1

295

295.1

In this Chapter—

      “ adverse environmental effect ” has the meaning given by  section 291
(4) ;           “ consent ” means any consent, approval, permission,
authorisation or confirmation (however described or given) that is required,
or otherwise provided for, by or under primary legislation;           “ DAERA
” means the Department of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs in
Northern Ireland;           “ England ” includes the English inshore region
and the English offshore region;           “ Minister of the Crown ” has the
same meaning as in the Ministers of the Crown Act 1975 (see section 8(1) of
that Act);           “ Northern Ireland ” includes the Northern Ireland
inshore region;           “ primary legislation ” means—         an Act of
Parliament,           an Act or Measure of Senedd Cymru,           an Act of
the Scottish Parliament, or           Northern Ireland legislation;
“ protected marine area ” has the meaning given by  section 291 (6) ;
“ public authority ” means—         a Minister of the Crown,           the
Scottish Ministers,           the Welsh Ministers,           a Northern
Ireland department, or           any other person with functions of a public
nature;                 “ relevant offshore wind activity ” has the meaning
given by  section 290 ;           “ Scotland ” includes the Scottish inshore
region and the Scottish offshore region;           “ UK marine area ” has the
meaning given by section 42(1) of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009;
“ Wales ” includes the Welsh inshore region and the Welsh offshore region.

295.2

References in this Chapter to the English, Scottish, Welsh or Northern Ireland
inshore and offshore regions are to be construed in accordance with the Marine
and Coastal Access Act 2009 (see section 322 of that Act).

295.3

References in this Chapter—

295.3.a

to a Scottish public authority are to the Scottish Ministers or any other
public authority whose functions are exercisable only or mainly in or as
regards Scotland;

295.3.b

to a Welsh public authority are to the Welsh Ministers or any other public
authority whose functions are exercisable only or mainly in or as regards
Wales;

295.3.c

to a Northern Ireland public authority are to a Northern Ireland department or
any other public authority whose functions are exercisable only or mainly in
or as regards Northern Ireland.

#### Oil and Gas

##### Environmental protection

###### Arrangements for responding to marine oil pollution

296

296.1

The Secretary of State may, by regulations, make provision—

296.1.a

requiring a person responsible for infrastructure or a place to which
subsection (2)  applies to have an emergency plan setting out arrangements for
responding to incidents which cause, or may cause, marine oil pollution,

296.1.b

in connection with that requirement, and

296.1.c

about the reporting of such incidents.

296.2

This subsection  applies to—

296.2.a

an offshore installation, or an offshore well, that is used for or in
connection with—

296.2.a.i

offshore oil and gas operations, or

296.2.a.ii

offshore production or storage of gas;

296.2.b

offshore infrastructure, including pipelines, connected to such an
installation or well;

296.2.c

a harbour;

296.2.d

a facility, that is not offshore, for handling or storing oil or gas;

296.2.e

infrastructure or a place described in any of  paragraphs (a)  to  (d)  that
is being decommissioned or has been decommissioned or abandoned.

296.3

Regulations under  subsection (1)  may, in particular, make provision in
connection with the implementation, maintenance and review of an emergency
plan, including provision requiring—

296.3.a

a person to refrain from carrying out activities that may cause marine oil
pollution unless and until an emergency plan is in place;

296.3.b

an emergency plan to be reviewed in accordance with the regulations;

296.3.c

the amendment or replacement of an emergency plan in circumstances specified
in the regulations;

296.3.d

a person to ensure readiness to carry out an emergency plan;

296.3.e

a person to carry out an emergency plan.

296.4

Regulations under  subsection (1)  about the reporting of incidents may, in
particular—

296.4.a

set out—

296.4.a.i

circumstances in which a report must be made;

296.4.a.ii

by whom a report must be made;

296.4.a.iii

to whom a report must be made;

296.4.b

make provision as to the content and form of a report and the time by which a
report must be made.

296.5

The Secretary of State may, by regulations, make provision enabling the
inspection of infrastructure or a place to which  subsection (2)  applies.

296.6

Regulations under  subsection (1)  or  (5)  may, in particular, make
provision—

296.6.a

about the meaning which any expression used in  subsection (1) ,  (2) ,  (3) ,
(4)  or  (5)  is to have for the purposes of regulations under  subsection (1)
or  (5) ;

296.6.b

conferring functions on any person;

296.6.c

providing for the charging of fees (but see  subsection (7) );

296.6.d

authorising or requiring, or restricting or prohibiting, the supply or keeping
of information (including provision authorising or requiring the supply or
keeping of information that would not otherwise be permitted);

296.6.e

creating criminal offences or impose civil penalties (but see  subsection (8)
);

296.6.f

for the purpose of securing compliance with requirements imposed by or under
regulations under  subsection (1)  or  (5) .

296.7

Regulations under  subsection (1)  or  (5)  which provide for a fee to be
charged in respect of a person performing a function or doing any other thing
must secure that, taking one year with another, the income from the fees does
not exceed the cost of performing the function or doing the thing.

296.8

Regulations under  subsection (1)  or  (5)  may not provide—

296.8.a

for a criminal offence to be punishable with imprisonment;

296.8.b

for a civil penalty to exceed £50,000.

296.9

Where regulations under subsection  (1)  or  (5)  provide for the imposition
of a civil penalty, they must also include provision for a right of appeal
against the imposition of the penalty.

296.10

Regulations under  subsection (1)  or  (5)  containing any of the following
(with or without other provision) are subject to the affirmative procedure—

296.10.a

provision creating a criminal offence or civil penalty (but excluding
provision modifying the circumstances in which a person is guilty of an
existing offence or liable for an existing civil penalty);

296.10.b

provision specifying a civil penalty amount.

296.11

Any other regulations under  subsection (1)  or  (5)  are subject to the
negative procedure.

296.12

In  this section —

      “ gas ” means—         “gas” within the meaning of section 2 of the
Energy Act 2008,           carbon dioxide, and           hydrogen;
“ oil ” means petroleum in any form including crude oil, fuel oil, sludge, oil
refuse and refined products.

###### Habitats: reducing effects of offshore oil or gas activities etc

297

297.1

The Secretary of State may, by regulations, make provision requiring the
Secretary of State to take into account the implications for relevant sites
when deciding whether, or how, to carry out a function (including a function
under other regulations under this section) which relates to—

297.1.a

offshore oil and gas activities, or

297.1.b

offshore production or storage of gas.

297.2

The Secretary of State may, by regulations, make provision—

297.2.a

prohibiting a specified description of activities from being carried out
unless the consent of the Secretary of State has been obtained, and

297.2.b

requiring a person who has obtained such a consent to carry out any activity
to which the consent relates in accordance with the consent (and any
conditions to which the consent is subject).

297.3

The Secretary of State may, by regulations, make provision preventing a
specified description of licence from being granted unless the Secretary of
State has or Scottish Ministers have—

297.3.a

carried out a specified description of assessment, and

297.3.b

confirmed that the outcome of that assessment does not prevent the licence
from being granted.

297.4

The Secretary of State may, by regulations, make provision—

297.4.a

authorising the Secretary of State to give a person directions to take steps,
or to refrain from taking steps, and

297.4.b

requiring a person given such a direction to comply with it.

297.5

The Secretary of State may make regulations under subsection  (2) ,  (3)  or
(4)  only if the Secretary of State considers that the regulations would
contribute to the protection of relevant sites from adverse effects of—

297.5.a

offshore oil and gas activities, or

297.5.b

offshore production or storage of gas.

297.6

For the purposes of regulations made under another provision of this section,
“ relevant site ” has the meaning determined in accordance with the
regulations; and those regulations—

297.6.a

must be framed so that relevant sites consist of natural habitats or habitats
of species;

297.6.b

may, where they are framed by reference to provision made by other
legislation, be framed so as to include natural habitats or habitats of
species that are likely to fall within that provision of that other
legislation.

297.7

Regulations under this section may—

297.7.a

make provision about the meaning which any expression used in this section is
to have for the purposes of regulations under this section;

297.7.b

confer functions on any person (including a function of giving advice in
relation to the application or exercise of any other function, whether
exercisable by that or another person, under regulations under this section);

297.7.c

provide for the modification or revocation of any consent given under
regulations under subsection  (2) ;

297.7.d

provide for the charging of fees;

297.7.e

authorise, or restrict or prohibit, the supply or keeping of information
(including authorisation of the supply or keeping of information that would
not otherwise be permitted);

297.7.f

create criminal offences or impose civil penalties (but see subsection  (8) );

297.7.g

make other provision for the purpose of securing compliance with requirements
imposed by or under regulations under this section.

297.8

Regulations under this section may not provide—

297.8.a

for a criminal offence to be punishable with imprisonment or, on summary
conviction, to a fine exceeding the statutory maximum;

297.8.b

for a civil penalty of a fixed amount to exceed £2,500 or of a variable amount
to exceed £50,000.

297.9

Where regulations under this section provide for the imposition of a civil
penalty, they must also include provision for a right of appeal against the
imposition of the penalty.

297.10

Regulations under this section are subject to the affirmative procedure.

297.11

In  this section —

      “ licence ” means anything (however described) which permits a person to
do something;           “ specified ” means specified in regulations under
this section.

###### Regulations under sections 

298

######### Regulations under section 

298.1

Before making regulations under section  296  that contain provision within
devolved competence, the Secretary of State must give notice to each relevant
devolved authority—

298.1.a

stating that the Secretary of State proposes to make regulations under that
section,

298.1.b

setting out or describing the provision that is within the relevant devolved
competence, and

298.1.c

specifying the period (of not less than 28 days from the date on which the
notice is given) within which representations may be made with respect to that
provision,

and must consider any representations duly made and not withdrawn.

298.2

The Secretary of State need not wait until the end of the period specified
under subsection  (1) (c)  before making regulations if, before the end of
that period, each relevant devolved authority to which the notice was given
has confirmed that it has made any representations it intends to make with
respect to the provision referred to in  subsection (1) (b) .

298.3

The Secretary of State must, if requested to do so by a relevant devolved
authority, give the authority a statement setting out whether and how
representations made by the authority with respect to the provision referred
to in  subsection (1) (b)  have been taken into account in the regulations.

298.4

In subsections  (1)  to  (3) , “ relevant devolved authority ”, in relation to
regulations, means—

298.4.a

the Scottish Ministers, if the regulations contain provision within Scottish
devolved competence;

298.4.b

the Welsh Ministers, if the regulations contain provision within Welsh
devolved competence;

298.4.c

the Department of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs in Northern
Ireland, if the regulations contain provision within Northern Ireland devolved
competence;

and “ the relevant devolved competence ”, in relation to a relevant devolved
authority, is to be construed accordingly.

######### Regulations under section 

298.5

The Secretary of State may not make regulations under section  297  containing
provision within Scottish devolved competence unless the Scottish Ministers
have consented to that provision.

298.6

The Secretary of State may not make regulations under section  297  containing
provision within Welsh devolved competence unless the Welsh Ministers have
consented to that provision.

######### Devolved competence

298.7

For the purposes of this section, provision—

298.7.a

is within Scottish devolved competence if it would be within the legislative
competence of the Scottish Parliament if it were contained in an Act of that
Parliament;

298.7.b

is within Welsh devolved competence if it would be within the legislative
competence of Senedd Cymru if it were contained in an Act of the Senedd
(ignoring any requirement for the consent of a Minister of the Crown imposed
under Schedule 7B to the Government of Wales Act 2006);

298.7.c

is within Northern Ireland devolved competence if it—

298.7.c.i

would be within the legislative competence of the Northern Ireland Assembly if
it were contained in an Act of that Assembly, and

298.7.c.ii

would not, if it were contained in a Bill in the Northern Ireland Assembly,
result in the Bill requiring the consent of the Secretary of State under
section 8 of the Northern Ireland Act 1998;

and references to provision being within devolved competence are to provision
that is within Scottish, Welsh or Northern Ireland devolved competence.

###### Model clauses of petroleum licences

300

300.1

Schedule 21  amends model clauses contained in—

300.1.a

the Petroleum (Production) (Landward Areas) Regulations 1995 ( S.I. 1995/1436
),

300.1.b

the Petroleum (Current Model Clauses) Order 1999 ( S.I. 1999/160 ),

300.1.c

the Petroleum Licensing (Exploration and Production) (Seaward and Landward
Areas) Regulations 2004 ( S.I. 2004/352 ),

300.1.d

the Petroleum Licensing (Production) (Seaward Areas) Regulations 2008 ( S.I.
2008/225 ), and

300.1.e

the Petroleum Licensing (Exploration and Production) (Landward Areas)
Regulations 2014 ( S.I. 2014/1686 ).

300.2

Where a licence granted (or having effect as if granted) by the Oil and Gas
Authority under the Petroleum (Production) Act 1934 or the Petroleum Act 1998—

300.2.a

incorporates model clauses amended by a paragraph of  Schedule 21  (whether or
not any provision of those model clauses is modified or excluded), and

300.2.b

is in force immediately before that paragraph comes into force,

the licence has effect with the amendments provided for by that paragraph.

300.3

The power conferred by reason of the amendment made by  paragraph 70 (2)  of
Schedule 21  to partially revoke a licence because of the occurrence of an
event mentioned in model clause 41(2)(h) in Schedule 2 to the Petroleum
Licensing (Exploration and Production) (Landward Areas) Regulations 2014 may
not be exercised as a result of such an event which occurred before the
commencement of paragraph  70  of  Schedule 21 .

300.4

A reference in any document to provisions of a licence which are amended by
Schedule 21  is to be construed, unless the nature of the document or the
context otherwise requires, as a reference to those provisions as amended.

300.5

A provision inserted in a licence by virtue of  Schedule 21  may be altered or
deleted by deed executed by the Secretary of State and the licensee or, as
respects Scotland, by an instrument subscribed or authenticated by the
Secretary of State and the licensee in accordance with the Requirements of
Writing (Scotland) Act 1995.

###### Power of OGA to require information about change in control of licensee

301

After section 5C of the Petroleum Act 1998 insert—

########## OGA’s power to require information about change in control of licensee

301.5D

301.5D.1

This section applies in relation to a licence granted (or having effect as if
granted) by the OGA under this Part which includes provisions prohibiting a
change in control of a licensee which is a company without the OGA’s consent.

301.5D.2

The OGA may by notice in writing require a person within subsection (3) to
provide the OGA with any information that it requires for the purpose of
exercising its functions in relation to a change or potential change in
control of a licensee which is a company.

301.5D.3

The persons within this subsection are—

301.5D.3.a

the company;

301.5D.3.b

the person who (if consent were granted) would take control of the company;

301.5D.3.c

if the company and another person or persons are the licensee, that other
person or those other persons;

301.5D.3.d

any person not within any of paragraphs (a) to (c) who appears to the OGA to
have information that it requires as mentioned in subsection (2).

301.5D.4

The power conferred by this section does not include power to require the
provision of any information that would be protected from disclosure or
production in legal proceedings on grounds of legal professional privilege or,
in Scotland, confidentiality of communications.

301.5D.5

Nothing in this section limits any power of the OGA to require information
under—

301.5D.5.a

regulations under this Part, or

301.5D.5.b

the terms of a licence under this Part.

##### Decommissioning of nuclear sites etc

303

303.1

The Nuclear Installations Act 1965 is amended as follows.

The reference in subsection (1) to operating a nuclear reactor or an

nuclear reactor or such an installation.

303.3

303.3.a

applicable condition or conditions set out in  section 3A  are met.” ;

303.3.b

after subsection (12) insert—

303.3.b.12A

The appropriate national authority must consult the Health and Safety
Executive before varying a nuclear site licence under subsection (12).

303.4

After section 3 insert—

########### Exclusion of part of site from licence: applicable conditions

303.4.3A

303.4.3A.1

This section sets out the applicable condition or conditions for excluding any
part of a licensed site (“ the relevant part ”) from a nuclear site licence.

303.4.3A.2

Where a prescribed disposal installation is or has at any time been situated
within the relevant part, the applicable condition is that there is no danger
from ionising radiations from anything on the relevant part.

303.4.3A.3

Where any nuclear installation, other than a prescribed disposal installation,
is or has at any time been situated within the relevant part, the applicable
conditions (subject to  subsection (5) ) are that—

303.4.3A.3.a

the use of any such installation within the relevant part has permanently
ceased,

303.4.3A.3.b

appropriate measures for the containment and control of any remaining
radioactivity are in place,

303.4.3A.3.c

the relevant part meets the radioactivity exclusion criteria and the dose
exclusion criteria, and

303.4.3A.3.d

it is no longer necessary or desirable in the interests of safety for a
nuclear site licence to be in force in respect of the relevant part.

303.4.3A.4

In any other case, the applicable conditions (subject to  subsection (5) ) are
that—

303.4.3A.4.a

the relevant part meets the dose exclusion criteria, and

303.4.3A.4.b

it is no longer necessary or desirable in the interests of safety for a
nuclear site licence to be in force in respect of the relevant part.

303.4.3A.5

In a case to which, but for this subsection, subsection  (3)  or  (4)  would
apply, the licensee may elect that the condition set out in  subsection (2)
is to apply to the relevant part (instead of the conditions in subsection  (3)
or  (4) ).

303.4.3A.6

In this section—

      “ 2014 Decision ” means the Decision and Recommendation of the Steering
Committee Concerning the Application of the Paris Convention to Nuclear
Installations in the Process of Being Decommissioned, published on 30 October
2014 by the Steering Committee for Nuclear Energy of the Nuclear Energy Agency
of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development;           “
dose exclusion criteria ” means the criteria described in paragraph 3(b) of
the Appendix to the 2014 Decision;           “ prescribed disposal
installation ” means an installation—         designed or adapted for the
disposal of nuclear matter, and           of a kind prescribed under section
1(1)(b) at any time after  section 303  of the Energy Act 2023 comes into
force;                 “ radioactivity exclusion criteria ” means the criteria
described in paragraph 3(a) of the Appendix to the 2014 Decision;           “
safety ”, in relation to the relevant part of a site, is to be construed in
accordance with section 4(2).

303.5

303.5.a

in the heading, omit “and surrender”;

303.5.b

in subsection (1)—

303.5.b.i

omit the “or” after paragraph (a);

303.5.b.ii

omit paragraph (b);

in subsection (2), after “consult” insert  “the Health and Safety Executive
and” ;

303.5.e.ii

.

########### End of period of responsibility: applicable conditions

303.6.5A

303.6.5A.1

304

304.1

304.2.c.3A.a

304.2.c.3A.b

;

;

304.2.f.ii

304.3

After section 7B insert—

########### Excluded disposal sites

304.3.7C

304.3.7C.1

A site that is used or intended to be used for the operation of an
installation for the disposal of nuclear matter is an excluded disposal site
if—

304.3.7C.1.a

the Secretary of State is satisfied, on an application by the operator of the
site, that the site meets—

304.3.7C.1.a.i

the permit condition,

304.3.7C.1.a.ii

the site history condition, and

304.3.7C.1.a.iii

such other conditions as may be prescribed, and

304.3.7C.1.b

the Secretary of State gives the operator notice in writing to that effect.

304.3.7C.2

In this section, “ disqualifying matter ” means nuclear matter that exceeds
the radioactivity concentration limits set out in paragraph 3(a) of the
Appendix to the 2016 Decision.

304.3.7C.3

The permit condition is that—

304.3.7C.3.a

an appropriate permit is in force in respect of the site, and

304.3.7C.3.b

that permit includes a condition preventing the site from receiving
disqualifying matter.

304.3.7C.4

The site history condition is that—

304.3.7C.4.a

disqualifying matter has not at any time been accepted for disposal at the
site, or

304.3.7C.4.b

any disqualifying matter previously accepted for disposal at the site has been
removed from the site.

304.3.7C.5

An application under  subsection (1) (a)  must be accompanied by such
documents as may be prescribed.

304.3.7C.6

Regulations made under  subsection (5)  may—

304.3.7C.6.a

specify requirements relating to the preparation, approval or review of a
prescribed document;

304.3.7C.6.b

require an operator to provide a copy of a prescribed document to a person
other than the Secretary of State;

304.3.7C.6.c

make different provision for different purposes.

304.3.7C.7

A site ceases to be an excluded disposal site if the site no longer meets the
permit condition or any condition prescribed under  subsection (1) (a) (iii) .

304.3.7C.8

Where the appropriate permit in force in respect of an excluded disposal site
is transferred to a new operator, the site ceases to be an excluded disposal
site at the end of the period of one month beginning with the date on which
the permit is transferred unless, before the end of that period—

304.3.7C.8.a

the new operator notifies the Secretary of State of the transfer, and

304.3.7C.8.b

the Secretary of State gives the new operator notice in writing that the
Secretary of State consents to the site continuing to be an excluded disposal
site.

304.3.7C.9

The Secretary of State must notify the Scottish Ministers of any notification
given under  subsection (1) (b)  in relation to a site in Scotland.

304.3.7C.10

In this section—

      “ 2016 Decision ” means the Decision and Recommendation Concerning the
Application of the Paris Convention on Third Party Liability in the Field of
Nuclear Energy to Nuclear Installations for the Disposal of Certain Types of
Low-level Radioactive Waste published on 16 January 2017 by the Steering
Committee for Nuclear Energy of the Nuclear Energy Agency of the Organisation
for Economic Co-operation and Development;           “ appropriate permit ”
has the meaning given in section 7B(9).

########### Excluded disposal sites: acceptance of disqualifying matter

304.3.7D

304.3.7D.1

This section applies where disqualifying matter is accepted at an excluded
disposal site; and for the purposes of this section the acceptance of such
matter is referred to as “ the breach ”.

304.3.7D.2

The operator of the site must notify the Secretary of State of the breach
before the end of the notification period.

304.3.7D.3

“ The notification period ” means the period of 21 days beginning with the day
on which the operator becomes aware of the breach.

304.3.7D.4

The site ceases to be an excluded disposal site at the end of the notification
period unless the operator complies with the duty under  subsection (2) .

304.3.7D.5

An operator who has complied with the duty under  subsection (2)  must remove
the disqualifying waste from the site before the end of the removal period.

304.3.7D.6

“ The removal period ” means—

304.3.7D.6.a

the period of 90 days beginning with the day on which the operator notifies
the Secretary of State of the breach, or

304.3.7D.6.b

such longer period as the Secretary of State may specify before the end of the
period mentioned in  paragraph (a)  if satisfied that the operator is taking
all reasonable steps to remove the disqualifying matter from the site.

304.3.7D.7

The site ceases to be an excluded disposal site at the end of the removal
period unless before the end of that period—

304.3.7D.7.a

the Secretary of State is satisfied that the disqualifying waste has been
removed from the site, and

304.3.7D.7.b

the Secretary of State gives the operator notice in writing to that effect.

304.3.7D.8

In this section, “ disqualifying matter ” has the meaning given by  section 7C
.

304.4

In section 20 (furnishing of information relating to operator’s cover), after
subsection (5) insert—

304.4.5A

Subsection (4) does not apply where the operator of a relevant disposal site
makes an application to the Secretary of State under section 7C(1)(a)
(application for site to be excluded disposal site).

304.5

In section 26(1) (interpretation), at the appropriate place insert—

      “ excluded disposal site ” has the meaning given by section 7C;

.

##### Accession to Convention on Supplementary Compensation for Nuclear Damage

305

Schedule 22  contains amendments to the Nuclear Installations Act 1965 to
implement the Convention on Supplementary Compensation for Nuclear Damage.

##### Power to implement Convention on Supplementary Compensation for Nuclear Damage

306

306.1

The Secretary of State may by regulations make such provision as the Secretary
of State considers appropriate—

306.1.a

to implement the CSC, or

306.1.b

otherwise for the purposes of dealing with any other matter arising out of, or
related to, the CSC.

306.2

The provision that may be made by virtue of subsection (1) includes provision
that is authorised by the CSC to be made in relation to a particular matter.

306.3

Regulations under this section may amend—

306.3.a

Schedule 22 ,

306.3.b

the Nuclear Installations Act 1965, or

306.3.c

any other enactment having effect in relation to a matter to which the CSC
relates.

306.4

In this section, “ the CSC ” means the Convention on Supplementary
Compensation for Nuclear Damage (as amended or supplemented from time to
time).

306.5

Regulations under this section are subject to the affirmative procedure.

#### Civil Nuclear Constabulary

##### Provision of additional police services

307

307.1

After section 55 of the Energy Act 2004 insert—

########### Additional services

############ Provision of additional police services

307.1.55A

307.1.55A.1

The Constabulary may, with the consent of the Secretary of State, provide
additional police services to any person.

307.1.55A.2

In this Chapter, “ additional police services ” means services relating to the
protection of places, persons or materials.

307.1.55A.3

In subsection (2), “ place ” includes—

307.1.55A.3.a

premises, facilities or equipment at a place;

307.1.55A.3.b

any vehicle, vessel, aircraft or hovercraft.

307.1.55A.4

The Secretary of State must not give consent for the purposes of  subsection
(1)  unless satisfied, on an application made by the Police Authority, that—

307.1.55A.4.a

the provision of the additional police services in question is in the
interests of national security,

307.1.55A.4.b

the provision by the Constabulary of those services will not prejudice the
carrying out of its primary function under section 52(2), and

307.1.55A.4.c

it is reasonable in all the circumstances for the Constabulary to provide
those services.

307.1.55A.5

Before giving consent for the purposes of  subsection (1) , the Secretary of
State must consult the chief constable.

307.1.55A.6

The chief constable must ensure that the provision by the Constabulary of
additional police services does not prejudice the carrying out of its primary
function under section 52(2).

307.1.55A.7

Consent given for the purposes of  subsection (1) —

307.1.55A.7.a

must specify the period of time (not exceeding 5 years) for which it has
effect;

307.1.55A.7.b

may, subject to subsections  (8)  and  (9) , be withdrawn at any time if the
Secretary of State is no longer satisfied of the matters mentioned in
subsection (4) .

307.1.55A.8

Where the Secretary of State proposes to withdraw consent given for the
purposes of subsection  (1) , the Secretary of State must consult the Police
Authority.

307.1.55A.9

If, following consultation under subsection  (8) , the Secretary of State
decides to withdraw consent given for the purposes of subsection  (1) , the
Secretary of State must give such notice to the Police Authority as is
reasonably practicable of the date on which the consent will cease to have
effect.

307.1.55A.10

The Police Authority may enter into an agreement with any person for the
provision of additional police services by the Constabulary under this
section.

307.1.55A.11

The Police Authority must publish, as soon as is reasonably practicable and in
such manner as the Authority considers appropriate—

307.1.55A.11.a

the name of any person or persons to whom additional police services are to be
provided under this section, and

307.1.55A.11.b

(subject to subsections  (12)  and  (13) ) such information about the place or
places at which those services are to be provided as the Police Authority
considers may be published without prejudicing the interests of national
security.

307.1.55A.12

The Police Authority must consult the Secretary of State before publishing the
information referred to in  subsection (11) (b) .

307.1.55A.13

The Secretary of State may direct the Police Authority not to publish
information about the place or places at which additional police services are
to be provided where the Secretary of State considers that publication of the
information would prejudice the interests of national security.

307.1.55A.14

The Police Authority must comply with a direction given by the Secretary of
State under  subsection (13) .

307.2

In section 56 of that Act (jurisdiction of Constabulary), after subsection (3)
insert—

307.2.3A

A member of the Constabulary has the powers and privileges of a constable at
every place where additional police services are being provided under  section
55A .

307.3

In section 71(1) of that Act (interpretation), at the appropriate place
insert—

      “ additional police services ” has the meaning given in  section 55A (2)
;

.

307.4

The Counter-Terrorism Act 2008 is amended as follows—

307.4.a

in section 85(2) (costs of policing at gas facilities: England and Wales),
after paragraph (a) omit “or” and insert—

307.4.a.aa

the services of the Civil Nuclear Constabulary provided under  section 55A  of
the Energy Act 2004, or

;

307.4.b

in section 86(2) (costs of policing at gas facilities: Scotland), after
paragraph (a) omit “or” and insert—

307.4.b.aa

the services of the Civil Nuclear Constabulary provided under  section 55A  of
the Energy Act 2004, or

.

#### Relevant nuclear pension schemes

##### Civil nuclear industry: amendment of relevant nuclear pension schemes

311

311.1

The Secretary of State may by regulations make provision requiring a
designated person to amend the provisions of a relevant nuclear pension scheme
in respect of which the person is designated—

311.1.a

for the purpose of making scheme-specific changes;

311.1.b

for the purpose of making changes that relate to any scheme-specific changes;

311.1.c

for the purpose of making contribution rate adjustments.

311.2

“ Scheme-specific changes ”, in relation to a relevant nuclear pension scheme,
are changes that—

311.2.a

relate to defined benefits for members of the scheme, and

311.2.b

are in connection with one or more of the matters mentioned in subsection  (3)
.

311.3

Those matters are—

311.3.a

securing that the structure under which the defined benefits in question
accrue is a career average revalued earnings structure (in particular where it
would otherwise be a final salary structure);

311.3.b

providing for other changes to the amounts of such of those defined benefits
as are payable in respect of members of the scheme;

311.3.c

providing for revaluations of pensionable earnings, or of benefits in
deferment or pensions in payment, to be by reference to the consumer prices
index (and not the retail prices index) but not involving imposing a cap on
any revaluation or revaluation rate;

311.3.d

setting percentage rates, for contributions to the scheme by members of the
scheme, that are higher than they would otherwise be;

311.3.e

setting periods for which contributions to the scheme by members of the scheme
are required to be made that are longer than they would otherwise be.

311.4

Amendments made by virtue of subsection  (1) (b)  may include amendments
relating to benefits provided under the scheme other than defined benefits.

311.5

“ Contribution rate adjustments ” means such adjustments—

311.5.a

to the rates of contributions to the scheme by its members in respect of
defined benefits, or

311.5.b

to the salary bands to which such contribution rates apply,

as are considered appropriate by the designated person (acting on actuarial
advice) to ensure that the average contribution rate for members of the scheme
in respect of defined benefits is as close as reasonably practicable to 8.2%.

311.6

Where a person is required by regulations under this section to amend the
provisions of a relevant nuclear pension scheme, the amendments may be made—

311.6.a

free from any consent requirements set out in the scheme, and

311.6.b

notwithstanding provision made by or under any other Act of Parliament, or any
rule of law, that would otherwise prevent or limit, or impose conditions on,
the making of the amendments.

311.7

Amendments made by virtue of subsection  (1) (a) —

311.7.a

must not relate to service prior to the date on which the amendments are made;

311.7.b

may be made in the case of a particular scheme on one occasion only.

311.8

Nothing in this section limits any power that a designated person has to amend
a relevant nuclear pension scheme.

311.9

A person may not be designated in relation to a relevant nuclear pension
scheme unless it appears to the Secretary of State that the person has the
power to amend the scheme.

311.10

In this section, “ designated ” means designated by regulations under this
section.

##### Meaning of “relevant nuclear pension scheme”

312

312.1

In this Chapter, “ relevant nuclear pension scheme ” means—

312.1.a

a pension scheme maintained by or on behalf of the NDA under or by virtue of
section 8(1)(a) or (b) of the Energy Act 2004, or

312.1.b

subject to subsections  (2)  and  (3) , a scheme that provides for the payment
of pensions or other benefits to or in respect of persons who are, or have
been, employed to perform duties relating to matters that correspond or are
similar to matters in respect of which the NDA has functions.

312.2

A scheme of a kind mentioned in subsection  (1) (b)  is a relevant nuclear
pension scheme only to the extent that the pensions or other benefits are
provided in connection with employment by a person with public functions.

312.3

Subsection  (1) (b)  does not apply to—

312.3.a

a UKAEA pension scheme (within the meaning given by paragraph 1(1) of Schedule
8 to the Energy Act 2004);

312.3.b

a scheme that provides for the payment of pensions or other benefits to or in
respect of persons specified in section 1(2) of the Public Service Pensions
Act 2013 (schemes for persons in public service).

312.4

In this section, “ the NDA ” means the Nuclear Decommissioning Authority.

##### Information

313

313.1

This section applies where a person (“ P ”) is required by regulations under
section 311  to amend a relevant nuclear pension scheme.

313.2

P may require a person who holds relevant information to provide it to P.

313.3

“ Relevant information ” means any information or data that P reasonably
requires in connection with deciding whether, or how, to amend the scheme.

313.4

Except as provided by subsection  (5) , the disclosure of information under
this section does not breach—

313.4.a

any obligation of confidence owed by the person making the disclosure, or

313.4.b

any other restriction on the disclosure of information (however imposed).

313.5

This section does not require a disclosure of information if the disclosure
would contravene the data protection legislation (but in determining whether a
disclosure would do so, a requirement imposed under subsection  (2)  is to be
taken into account).

##### Further definitions

314

314.1

This section applies for the purposes of this Chapter.

314.2

References to the amendment of a relevant nuclear pension scheme include
references to the amendment of any one or more of the following—

314.2.a

the trust deed of the scheme, if there is one;

314.2.b

rules of the scheme;

314.2.c

any other instrument relating to the constitution, management or operation of
the scheme.

314.3

References to a relevant nuclear pension scheme include references to any
section into which the scheme is divided.

314.4

A “career average revalued earnings structure” is a structure where—

314.4.a

the pension payable to or in respect of a person, so far as it is based on the
person’s pensionable service, is determined by reference to the person’s
pensionable earnings in each year of pensionable service, and

314.4.b

those earnings, or a proportion of those earnings accrued as a pension, are
under the structure revalued each year until the person leaves pensionable
service.

314.5

“ Consumer prices index ” means—

314.5.a

the general index of consumer prices (for all items) published by the
Statistics Board, or

314.5.b

where that index is not published for a month, any substituted index or
figures published by the Board.

314.6

“Defined benefits” are benefits—

314.6.a

that are not money purchase benefits (within the meaning of the Pension
Schemes Act 1993), and

314.6.b

that are not provided under an injury or compensation scheme (within the
meaning of the Public Service Pensions Act 2013).

314.7

A “final salary structure” is a structure where entitlement to the pension
payable to or in respect of a person which is based on the pensionable service
of that person is or may be determined to any extent by reference to the
person’s final salary; and “final salary” here means the person’s pensionable
earnings, or highest, average or representative pensionable earnings, in a
specified period ending at, or defined by reference to, the time when the
person’s pensionable service in relation to the structure terminates.

314.8

“ Retail prices index ” means—

314.8.a

the general index of retail prices (for all items) published by the Statistics
Board, or

314.8.b

where that index is not published for a month, any substituted index or
figures published by the Board.

##### Application of relevant pensions legislation

315

315.1

The Secretary of State may by regulations make—

315.1.a

such provision about the application of relevant pensions legislation in
relation to persons of a specified description, or

315.1.b

such amendments of relevant pensions legislation,

as the Secretary of State considers appropriate for the purposes of or in
connection with the amendment of a relevant nuclear pension scheme in
pursuance of regulations under  section 311 .

315.2

In this section—

      “ relevant pensions legislation ” means—         Schedule 8 to the
Energy Act 2004 (pensions), or           regulations made under Schedule 14 or
15 to the Electricity Act 1989 (the Electricity Supply Pension Scheme etc);
“ specified ” means specified in regulations under subsection  (1) .

##### Procedure for regulations under Chapter 3

316

316.1

Regulations under this Chapter are subject to the affirmative procedure.

316.2

If, apart from this subsection, a draft of an instrument containing
regulations under this Chapter would be treated for the purposes of the
standing orders of either House of Parliament as a hybrid instrument, it is to
proceed in that House as if it were not such an instrument.

#### Great British Nuclear

##### Great British Nuclear: designation, status and objects

###### Great British Nuclear

317

317.1

The Secretary of State may by notice designate a company as Great British
Nuclear.

317.2

A company may be designated under this section only if—

317.2.a

it is limited by shares, and

317.2.b

it is wholly owned by the Crown.

317.3

A notice under  subsection (1) —

317.3.a

must specify the time from which the designation has effect, and

317.3.b

must be published by the Secretary of State as soon as reasonably practicable
after the notice is given.

317.4

The designation of a company terminates—

317.4.a

if it ceases to be wholly owned by the Crown, or

317.4.b

if the Secretary of State revokes its designation by notice.

317.5

A notice under  subsection (4) (b) —

317.5.a

must specify the time from which the revocation has effect, and

317.5.b

must be published by the Secretary of State as soon as reasonably practicable
after the notice is given.

317.6

For the purposes of this section a company is wholly owned by the Crown if
each share in the company is held by—

317.6.a

a Minister of the Crown,

317.6.b

the Nuclear Decommissioning Authority established by section 1 of the Energy
Act 2004,

317.6.c

the United Kingdom Atomic Energy Authority established by section 1 of the
Atomic Energy Authority Act 1954,

317.6.d

a company which is wholly owned by the Crown, or

317.6.e

a nominee of a person falling within any of paragraphs  (a)  to  (d) .

317.7

A company designated as Great British Nuclear under this section is exempt
from the requirement in section 59 of the Companies Act 2006 (requirement as
to use of “limited” in company name).

317.8

In this section—

      “ company ” means a company registered under the Companies Act 2006;
“ Minister of the Crown ” has the same meaning as in the Ministers of the
Crown Act 1975 (see section 8(1) of that Act).

###### Crown status

318

318.1

Great British Nuclear is not to be regarded as a servant or agent of the Crown
or as enjoying any status, immunity or privilege of the Crown.

318.2

Great British Nuclear’s property is not to be regarded as property of, or
property held on behalf of, the Crown.

###### Great British Nuclear’s objects

319

Great British Nuclear’s objects are to facilitate the design, construction,
commissioning and operation of nuclear energy generation projects for the
purpose of furthering any policies published by His Majesty's government.

##### Financial assistance and directions etc

###### Financial assistance

320

320.1

The Secretary of State may provide financial assistance—

320.1.a

to Great British Nuclear, or

320.1.b

to any other person to facilitate the design, construction, commissioning and
operation of nuclear energy generation projects.

320.2

Financial assistance under this section may be provided in any form and in
particular may be provided—

320.2.a

by way of grant, loan, guarantee or indemnity,

320.2.b

by the acquisition of shares or any other interest in, or securities of, a
body corporate,

320.2.c

by the acquisition of any undertaking or of any assets,

320.2.d

pursuant to a contract, or

320.2.e

by incurring expenditure for the benefit of the person assisted.

320.3

Financial assistance under this section may be provided subject to such
conditions as the Secretary of State considers appropriate, which may include—

320.3.a

conditions about repayment with or without interest or other return, or

320.3.b

conditions with which Great British Nuclear or any recipient of financial
assistance under  subsection (1) (b)  must comply if the financial assistance
is used for—

320.3.b.i

acquiring shares or any other interest in, or securities of, a body corporate,
or

320.3.b.ii

participating in a partnership or joint venture.

320.4

The power to provide financial assistance under this section is in addition to
(and does not limit or replace) any other power of a Minister of the Crown to
provide financial assistance.

320.5

In this section—

      “ Minister of the Crown ” has the same meaning as in the Ministers of
the Crown Act 1975 (see section 8(1) of that Act);           “ partnership ”
means—         a partnership within the meaning of the Partnership Act 1890,
or           a limited partnership within the meaning of the Limited
Partnerships Act 1907.

###### Secretary of State directions and guidance

321

321.1

The Secretary of State may from time to time give Great British Nuclear
directions or guidance.

321.2

Before giving a direction or issuing guidance the Secretary of State must
consult Great British Nuclear and such other persons as the Secretary of State
considers appropriate.

321.3

Directions may be general or particular in character.

321.4

Great British Nuclear must—

321.4.a

comply with any directions given to it under this section, and

321.4.b

have regard to any guidance given to it under this section.

321.5

The Secretary of State must—

321.5.a

publish and lay before Parliament any directions given to Great British
Nuclear under this section, and

321.5.b

publish any guidance given to Great British Nuclear under this section.

##### Annual report and accounts

###### Annual report

322

322.1

Great British Nuclear must, after the end of each reporting year, send a
report to the Secretary of State about the activities it has undertaken during
that year.

322.2

The Secretary of State must lay a copy of the report before Parliament
together with any comments that the Secretary of State considers appropriate.

322.3

In this section “ reporting year ”, in relation to Great British Nuclear,
means a period of 12 months ending with 31 March (but does not include any
period before its designation as Great British Nuclear).

###### Annual accounts

323

323.1

Great British Nuclear must send a copy of its accounts and reports for each
financial year to the Secretary of State before the end of the period for
filing those accounts and reports.

323.2

The Secretary of State must lay a copy of any accounts and reports received
under  subsection (1)  before Parliament.

323.3

In this section—

      “ accounts and reports ”, in relation to Great British Nuclear, means
the annual accounts and reports that Great British Nuclear’s directors must
deliver to the registrar under section 441 of the Companies Act 2006;
“ financial year ”, in relation to Great British Nuclear, means Great British
Nuclear’s financial year determined in accordance with section 390 of the
Companies Act 2006;           “ period for filing ”, in relation to accounts
and reports for a financial year, has the same meaning as in the Companies
Acts (see section 442 of the Companies Act 2006);           “ the registrar ”
has the meaning given by section 1060(3) of the Companies Act 2006.

##### Transfers and pension arrangements etc

###### Transfer schemes

324

324.1

The Secretary of State may make one or more schemes for the transfer of
property, rights and liabilities—

324.1.a

to a GBN body or a proposed GBN body from—

324.1.a.i

a former GBN body;

324.1.a.ii

a GBN body;

324.1.a.iii

a proposed GBN body;

324.1.a.iv

a Minister of the Crown or Crown body;

324.1.a.v

a designated BNFL body;

324.1.a.vi

an NDA body;

324.1.a.vii

a UKAEA body;

324.1.a.viii

a nominee of a person falling within any of sub-paragraphs  (i)  to  (vii) ;

324.1.b

to a former GBN body, a Minister of the Crown or Crown body, a designated BNFL
body or a public body from—

324.1.b.i

a former GBN body;

324.1.b.ii

a GBN body.

324.2

The things that may be transferred under a transfer scheme include—

324.2.a

rights and liabilities relating to a contract of employment;

324.2.b

property, rights and liabilities that could not otherwise be transferred;

324.2.c

property acquired, and rights and liabilities arising, after the making of the
scheme;

324.2.d

criminal liabilities.

324.3

A transfer scheme may—

324.3.a

create rights, or impose liabilities, in relation to property, rights or
liabilities transferred;

324.3.b

make provision about the continuing effect of things done by a transferor in
respect of anything transferred;

324.3.c

make provision about the continuation of things (including legal proceedings)
in the process of being done by, on behalf of or in relation to a transferor
in respect of anything transferred;

324.3.d

make provision for references to a transferor in an instrument or other
document in respect of anything transferred to be treated as references to the
transferee;

324.3.e

make provision for shared ownership or use of the property;

324.3.f

make provision for apportioning property, rights or liabilities;

324.3.g

require a transferor, an associate of a transferor, or a transferee, to enter
into any agreement of any kind, or for a purpose, specified in or determined
in accordance with the scheme;

324.3.h

make provision for transferring property, rights and liabilities irrespective
of any requirement for consent that would otherwise apply;

324.3.i

make provision for preventing a right of pre-emption, right of reverter, right
of forfeiture, right to compensation or other similar right from arising or
becoming exercisable as a result of the transfer of property, rights or
liabilities;

324.3.j

make provision for dispensing with any formality in relation to the transfer
of property, rights or liabilities by the scheme;

324.3.k

make provision for reimbursing any person in respect of expenditure reasonably
incurred by the person in connection with the making of a transfer scheme;

324.3.l

make provision that has the same or similar effect to the TUPE regulations;

324.3.m

make other consequential, supplementary, incidental or transitional provision.

324.4

A transfer scheme may provide—

324.4.a

for modifications by agreement;

324.4.b

for modifications to have effect from the date when the original scheme came
into effect.

324.5

A transfer scheme may make provision requiring a transferor to provide such
co-operation to a transferee as the transferee may reasonably require in
connection with the implementation of the scheme.

324.6

The co-operation that may be required by virtue of  subsection (5)  includes,
in particular, co-operation in relation to—

324.6.a

the provision of information;

324.6.b

consultation with representatives of employees transferred by the scheme.

324.7

Any requirement imposed on a person by a transfer scheme is enforceable by the
Secretary of State in civil proceedings—

324.7.a

for an injunction,

324.7.b

for specific performance of a statutory duty under section 45 of the Court of
Session Act 1988, or

324.7.c

for any other appropriate remedy or relief.

324.8

Before making a transfer scheme, the Secretary of State must consult—

324.8.a

the transferor (or, if there is more than one transferor, the transferors),
and

324.8.b

such other persons as the Secretary of State considers appropriate.

324.9

Subsection (8)  may be satisfied by consultation before the passing of this
Act (as well as by consultation after that time).

324.10

The making of a transfer scheme is not a trigger event for the purposes of the
National Security and Investment Act 2021.

324.11

In this section—

      “ associate ” has the meaning given by section 1152 of the Companies Act
2006;           “ company ” means a company registered under the Companies Act
2006;           “ Crown body ” means any body corporate in which a Minister of
the Crown holds, directly or indirectly, any shares or other interest;
“ designated BNFL body ” means a company designated for the purposes of
Schedule 7 to the Energy Act 2004 or any body corporate in which a company
designated for those purposes holds, directly or indirectly, any shares or
other interest;           “ former GBN body ” means—         a company
formerly designated as Great British Nuclear, or           any body corporate
in which a company formerly designated as Great British Nuclear—
holds, directly or indirectly, any shares or other interest, and
held, directly or indirectly, any shares or other interest, at a time at which
it was designated as Great British Nuclear;                       “ GBN body ”
means Great British Nuclear or any body corporate in which Great British
Nuclear holds, directly or indirectly, any shares or other interest;
“ information ” includes documents;           “ Minister of the Crown ” has
the same meaning as in the Ministers of the Crown Act 1975 (see section 8(1)
of that Act);           “ NDA company ” means the Nuclear Decommissioning
Authority (established by section 1 of the Energy Act 2004) or any body
corporate in which the Nuclear Decommissioning Authority holds, directly or
indirectly, any shares or other interest;           “ proposed GBN body ”
means a company that the Secretary of State proposes to designate as Great
British Nuclear or any body corporate in which a company proposed to be
designated for those purposes holds, directly or indirectly, any shares or
other interest;           “ public body ” means a body established by an
enactment (within the meaning of  Part 1  of this Act) or any body corporate
in which a body established by an enactment holds, directly or indirectly, any
shares or other interest;           “ the TUPE regulations ” means the
Transfer of Undertakings (Protection of Employment) Regulations 2006 ( S.I.
2006/246 );           “ UKAEA body ” means the United Kingdom Atomic Energy
Authority (established by section 1 of the Atomic Energy Authority Act 1954)
or any body corporate in which the United Kingdom Atomic Energy Authority
holds, directly or indirectly, any shares or other interest.

###### Transfer schemes: compensation

325

325.1

A scheme under  section 324  may provide for a transferor or any person who
has suffered loss or damage in consequence of the scheme to be entitled to
compensation from the Secretary of State or a transferee under the scheme, in
accordance with provision made by or under the scheme.

325.2

Where a person is entitled to compensation, the amount of compensation is to
be the amount—

325.2.a

agreed by the Secretary of State and the person, or

325.2.b

in the absence of such agreement, determined by an independent valuer.

325.3

An independent valuer appointed for the purposes of  subsection (2)  must be
appointed—

325.3.a

by the Secretary of State and the person, or

325.3.b

in the absence of such agreement, by the Secretary of State on behalf of both
the Secretary of State and the person.

325.4

The Secretary of State may by regulations make provision about compensation
under this section that corresponds or is similar to any provision about
compensation that may be made by the Secretary of State by regulations under
paragraph 8 (4)  of  Schedule 9 .

325.5

Regulations under this section are subject to the negative procedure.

###### Transfer schemes: taxation

326

326.1

The Treasury may by regulations make provision varying the way in which a
relevant tax has effect in relation to—

326.1.a

anything transferred under a scheme under  section 324 , or

326.1.b

anything done for the purposes of, or in relation to, a transfer under such a
scheme.

326.2

The provision that may be made under  subsection (1) (a)  includes, in
particular, provision for—

326.2.a

a tax provision not to apply, or to apply with modifications, in relation to
anything transferred;

326.2.b

anything transferred to be treated in a specified way for the purposes of a
tax provision;

326.2.c

the Secretary of State to be required or permitted to determine, or to specify
the method for determining, anything that needs to be determined for the
purposes of any tax provision so far as relating to anything transferred.

326.3

The provision that may be made under  subsection (1) (b)  includes, in
particular, provision for—

326.3.a

a tax provision not to apply, or to apply with modifications, in relation to
anything done for the purposes of, or in relation to, the transfer;

326.3.b

anything done for the purposes of, or in relation to, the transfer to have or
not have a specified consequence or be treated in a specified way;

326.3.c

the Secretary of State to be required or permitted to determine, or to specify
the method for determining, anything that needs to be determined for the
purposes of any tax provision so far as relating to anything done for the
purposes of, or in relation to, the transfer.

326.4

In this section—

326.4.a

“ relevant tax ” means income tax, corporation tax, capital gains tax, stamp
duty, stamp duty reserve tax, stamp duty land tax or value added tax;

326.4.b

“ tax provision ” means any provision—

326.4.b.i

about a relevant tax, and

326.4.b.ii

made by an enactment (within the meaning of  Part 1  of this Act);

326.4.c

references to the transfer of a property include the grant of the lease.

326.5

A statutory instrument containing regulations under this section is subject to
annulment in pursuance of a resolution of the House of Commons.

###### Transfer schemes: provision of information or assistance

327

327.1

The Secretary of State may direct a person within  subsection (2)  to provide
the Secretary of State with such specified information or assistance as the
Secretary of State may reasonably require in connection with the making of a
scheme under  section 324 .

327.2

A person is within this subsection if—

327.2.a

property, rights or liabilities are likely to be transferred from or to the
person by such a scheme, or

327.2.b

the person is a body corporate that is likely to be transferred under such a
scheme.

327.3

Paragraph  12 (4) ,  (6) ,  (7)  and  (8)  of  Schedule 9  apply to a
direction under this section as they apply to a direction under  sub-paragraph
(1)  of that paragraph.

327.4

In this section—

      “ assistance ” includes assistance provided in a country or territory
other than the United Kingdom;           “ information ” includes documents;
“ specified ” means specified in the direction.

###### Reimbursement and compensation in connection with designation

328

The Secretary of State may reimburse a person in respect of expenditure
reasonably incurred by the person in preparation for or in connection with the
designation of a company under  section 317  (other than any expenditure
incurred in connection with the making of a scheme under section  324 ).

###### Pension arrangements in connection with Great British Nuclear

329

329.1

The Secretary of State may by regulations make provision about pension
arrangements in relation to Great British Nuclear that corresponds or is
similar to any provision about pension arrangements in relation to the ISOP
that may be made by the Secretary of State by regulations under  paragraph 2
or  3  of  Schedule 10  (see  paragraph 4  of that Schedule for restrictions
on how the power to make regulations under  paragraph 2  or  3  of that
Schedule may be exercised).

329.2

Before making regulations under  subsection (1)  that make provision
corresponding or similar to the provision that may be made by regulations
under  paragraph 2 (1)  of  Schedule 10 , the Secretary of State must carry
out a consultation corresponding to the consultation required by  paragraph 2
(5)  of that Schedule.

329.3

Before making regulations under  subsection (1)  that make provision
corresponding or similar to the provision that may be made by regulations
under  paragraph 3 (1)  of  Schedule 10 , the Secretary of State must carry
out a consultation corresponding to the consultation required by  paragraph 3
(4)  of that Schedule.

329.4

Subsections  (2)  and  (3)  may be satisfied by consultation before the
passing of this Act (as well as by consultation after that time).

329.5

The Secretary of State may direct a person within  subsection (6)  to provide
the Secretary of State with specified pensions information or such specified
assistance as the Secretary of State may reasonably require in preparation for
or in connection with the exercise of the power conferred on the Secretary of
State by  subsection (1) .

329.6

The following persons are within this subsection—

329.6.a

the trustee of a qualifying pension scheme;

329.6.b

any person who exercises functions on behalf of a person within paragraph (a);

329.6.c

any person who is or has been an employer of a qualifying member of a
qualifying pension scheme.

329.7

Sub-paragraphs  (5)  to  (7)  of  paragraph 5  of  Schedule 10  apply to a
direction given under  subsection (5)  as they apply to a direction given
under  sub-paragraph (1)  of that paragraph.

329.8

The exercise of the power conferred on the Secretary of State by  subsection
(1)  is not a trigger event for the purposes of the National Security and
Investment Act 2021.

329.9

In this section—

      “ pensions information ” means information that—         relates to
pensions or other benefits under a qualifying pension scheme, or
relates to the administration of a qualifying pension scheme in respect of
pensions or other benefits under the scheme;                 “ qualifying
member ”, in relation to a qualifying pension scheme, means a person who is or
has been a member (as defined by section 124(1) of the Pensions Act 1995) of
the scheme;           “ qualifying pension scheme ” means a pension scheme
that provides for the payment of pensions or other benefits to or in respect
of employees or former employees of—         a transferor in relation to a
transfer scheme under  section 324 , or           an associate (as defined by
section 1152 of the Companies Act 2006) of such a transferor;
“ specified ” means specified in the direction.

329.10

Regulations under this section are subject to the negative procedure.

### General

#### Power to make consequential provision

330

330.1

The Secretary of State may by regulations make such provision as the Secretary
of State considers appropriate in consequence of or in connection with—

330.1.a

this Act, other than sections  205  to  208 , or

330.1.b

any provision made under this Act.

330.2

The power to make regulations under subsection  (1)  may (among other things)
be exercised by amending, repealing or revoking—

330.2.a

provision made by or under this Act or by or under primary legislation passed
before, or in the same Session as, this Act;

330.2.b

retained direct EU legislation.

330.3

In this section, “ primary legislation ” means—

330.3.a

an Act,

330.3.b

an Act or Measure of Senedd Cymru,

330.3.c

an Act of the Scottish Parliament, or

330.3.d

Northern Ireland legislation.

330.4

Subject to subsection  (5) , regulations under subsection  (1)  are subject to
the negative procedure.

330.5

Where regulations under subsection  (1)  amend or repeal provision made by
primary legislation, the regulations are subject to the affirmative procedure.

#### Regulations

331

331.1

Regulations under this Act made by the Secretary of State, the Treasury or the
GEMA are to be made by statutory instrument.

331.2

Regulations under this Act may make—

331.2.a

different provision for different purposes or different areas;

331.2.b

supplementary, incidental, consequential, transitional or saving provision.

331.3

Where regulations under this Act are subject to the affirmative procedure,
they may not be made unless a draft of the statutory instrument containing
them has been laid before, and approved by a resolution of, each House of
Parliament.

331.4

Where regulations under this Act are subject to the negative procedure, the
statutory instrument containing them is subject to annulment in pursuance of a
resolution of either House of Parliament.

331.5

Where regulations under this Act are subject to the made affirmative
procedure, the statutory instrument containing them must be laid before
Parliament after being made.

331.6

Regulations under this Act contained in a statutory instrument laid before
Parliament under  subsection (5)  cease to have effect at the end of the
period of 28 days beginning with the day on which the instrument is made
unless, during that period, the instrument is approved by a resolution of each
House of Parliament.

331.7

In calculating the period of 28 days, no account is to be taken of any whole
days that fall within a period during which—

331.7.a

Parliament is dissolved or prorogued, or

331.7.b

either House of Parliament is adjourned for more than four days.

331.8

If regulations cease to have effect as a result of  subsection (6) , that does
not—

331.8.a

affect the validity of anything previously done under the regulations, or

331.8.b

prevent the making of new regulations.

331.9

Any provision that may be included in regulations under this Act subject to
the negative procedure may be made by regulations subject to the affirmative
procedure or the made affirmative procedure.

331.10

Any provision that may be included in regulations under this Act subject to
the made affirmative procedure may be made by regulations subject to the
affirmative procedure.

#### General definitions

332

In this Act—

      “ the affirmative procedure ” and “the negative procedure” are to be
construed in accordance with section  331 (3)  and  (4)  respectively and “
the made affirmative procedure ” is to be construed in accordance with
section 331 (5) ;           “ the GEMA ” means the Gas and Electricity Markets
Authority.

  Interim power of Secretary of State to grant licences

Section 16

1

1.1

Sections  7  to  12  are to have effect with the following modifications until
the end of the interim period.

1.2

In this Schedule “ the interim period ” means the period beginning when this
Schedule comes into force and ending with whatever day the Secretary of State
specifies by regulations.

1.3

Regulations under this paragraph are subject to the negative procedure.

2

In  section 7  (power to grant licences)—

2.a

in  subsection (1)  for “economic regulator” substitute  “Secretary of State”
;

2.b

after  subsection (2)  insert—

2.b.3

As soon as practicable after granting a licence, the Secretary of State must
send a copy of the licence to the economic regulator.

`

3

In  section 9  (procedure for licence applications)—

3.a

in  subsection (1) , in the words before paragraph (a), for “Secretary of
State, or the economic regulator with the approval of the Secretary of State,”
substitute  “Secretary of State” ;

3.b

substitute  “Secretary of State” ;

3.c

for  subsection (5)  substitute—

3.c.5

A notice under  subsection (4)  must be given by—

3.c.5.a

sending a copy of the notice to the economic regulator and any appropriate
devolved authority, and

3.c.5.b

publishing the notice in such manner as the Secretary of State considers

3.d.10A
