  Competitive tenders for electricity projects

Section 203

##### Amendments of Electricity Act 1989

1

The Electricity Act 1989 is amended as follows.

2

After section 6B insert—

######### Meaning of “relevant electricity project”, “relevant licence” and “relevant contract”

2.6BA

2.6BA.1

In this Part, “ relevant electricity project ” means a project—

2.6BA.1.a

that relates to the total system, an electricity interconnector or a multi-
purpose interconnector, and

2.6BA.1.b

in relation to which criteria specified in regulations made by the Secretary
of State are satisfied.

2.6BA.2

In subsection  (1) (a) , “ the total system ” means all transmission systems
and distribution systems in Great Britain and offshore waters.

2.6BA.3

In this Part, “ relevant licence ” means—

2.6BA.3.a

a transmission licence that does not authorise the licence holder to co-
ordinate and direct the flow of electricity as described in section 4(3A)(a);

2.6BA.3.b

a generation licence, a distribution licence, an interconnector licence or an
MPI licence.

2.6BA.4

In this Part, “ relevant contract ” means a contract, entered into by a person
with the holder of a transmission licence, a system operator electricity
licence or a distribution licence (referred to in this Part as a “ contract
counterparty ”), for the carrying out of a relevant electricity project.

2.6BA.5

Regulations under this section may make different provision for different
purposes.

2.6BA.6

Before making regulations under this section, the Secretary of State must
consult—

2.6BA.6.a

the Authority,

2.6BA.6.b

such holders of relevant licences as the Secretary of State considers
appropriate, and

2.6BA.6.c

such other persons as the Secretary of State considers appropriate.

######### Designation of a delivery body

2.6BB

2.6BB.1

The Secretary of State may by regulations designate a person for the purposes
of this section; and a person so designated is referred to in this Part as a “
delivery body ”.

2.6BB.2

The designation of a person for the purposes of this section has effect
subject to any conditions imposed by the Secretary of State in the regulations
designating the person.

2.6BB.3

More than one person may be designated for the purposes of this section at the
same time.

2.6BB.4

Regulations under this section may designate different persons for different
purposes.

2.6BB.5

The Secretary of State may by regulations revoke a person’s designation if the
person ceases to meet any condition subject to which the designation has
effect.

2.6BB.6

The Secretary of State may make indemnity payments to a delivery body (subject
to subsection  (9) ).

2.6BB.7

An indemnity payment is a payment in respect of costs or expenses incurred by
a delivery body in connection with judicial review proceedings in relation to
anything done, or omitted to be done, in the exercise (or purported exercise)
of functions conferred on the body by regulations under section  6C .

2.6BB.8

An indemnity payment may be made subject to such conditions as may be
determined by the Secretary of State.

2.6BB.9

Subsection  (6)  does not authorise the making of a payment to the Authority
(where it is designated under subsection  (1) ).

3

For sections 6C and 6D substitute—

######### Competitive tenders

3.6C

3.6C.1

The Authority may by regulations (“ tender regulations ”) make such provision
as appears to it to be appropriate for facilitating the making by a delivery
body of—

3.6C.1.a

a decision whether to hold a tender exercise in relation to a relevant
electricity project;

3.6C.1.b

in prescribed circumstances, a determination on a competitive basis of any of
the matters listed in subsection  (2) .

3.6C.2

Those matters are—

3.6C.2.a

the person by whom a relevant electricity project is to be carried out;

3.6C.2.b

the person to whom a relevant licence is to be granted (whether for the
purposes of a relevant electricity project or otherwise);

3.6C.2.c

the person to whom a relevant contract is to be awarded.

3.6C.3

The provision mentioned in subsection  (1)  includes—

3.6C.3.a

provision for the Authority to determine, in prescribed cases, whether a
tender exercise should be held, or continued, in relation to a relevant
electricity project;

3.6C.3.b

provision for the publication, in prescribed cases, of a proposal for a
relevant licence to be granted or for a relevant contract to be awarded;

3.6C.3.c

provision for the inclusion in such a proposal of an invitation to apply for
such a licence or to bid for such a contract;

3.6C.3.d

provision restricting applications and bids and imposing requirements as to
the period within which they must be made;

3.6C.3.e

provision for regulating the manner in which applications and bids are
considered and determined.

3.6C.4

The provision mentioned in subsection  (1)  also includes—

3.6C.4.a

provision conferring functions on a delivery body;

3.6C.4.b

provision authorising the Authority to conduct a review of the exercise by a
delivery body of functions conferred on it by the regulations;

3.6C.4.c

provision authorising the Authority to appoint another person to conduct such
a review on the Authority’s behalf.

3.6C.5

The provision that may be made by virtue of subsection  (4) (a)  includes
provision requiring a delivery body, in prescribed circumstances, to provide
information about prescribed matters to the Authority.

3.6C.6

Tender regulations—

3.6C.6.a

may make provision by reference to a determination by the Authority or by a
delivery body, or to the opinion of the Authority or of a delivery body, as to
any matter;

3.6C.6.b

may dispense with or supplement provision made in relation to applications for
relevant licences by or under section 6A or 6B.

3.6C.7

The approval of the Secretary of State is required for the making of tender
regulations.

3.6C.8

The making of a determination by virtue of subsection  (2) (b)  or  (c)  that
a person is to be granted a relevant licence or awarded a relevant contract
does not of itself require—

3.6C.8.a

the Authority to exercise its power to grant a relevant licence to the person,
or

3.6C.8.b

a contract counterparty to award a relevant contract to the person,

(as the case may be).

######### Power to require information

3.6CA

3.6CA.1

Tender regulations may include provision authorising a person to whom
subsection  (2)  applies (“ P ”), by notice given to another person (an
“information notice”), to require the other person to provide relevant
information to P.

3.6CA.2

This subsection applies to—

3.6CA.2.a

the Authority;

3.6CA.2.b

a delivery body;

3.6CA.2.c

a contract counterparty.

3.6CA.3

“ Relevant information ” means information that P reasonably requires for the
purposes of or in connection with the exercise of P’s functions.

3.6CA.4

References in this section to the Authority include a person appointed by the
Authority by virtue of section  6C (4) (c) , where the information sought
relates to a function conferred by virtue of section  6C (4) (b)  (review of
activities of delivery body).

3.6CA.5

Provision made by virtue of subsection  (1)  must require an information
notice—

3.6CA.5.a

to specify or describe the information sought, and

3.6CA.5.b

to specify the time by which the information must be provided.

3.6CA.6

Provision made by virtue of subsection  (1)  may include provision—

3.6CA.6.a

for an information notice and information obtained in pursuance of it to be
shared with the Authority, where the notice is given by a person other than
the Authority;

3.6CA.6.b

for the classification and protection of confidential or sensitive
information;

3.6CA.6.c

for the enforcement by the Authority of a requirement to provide information
in pursuance of an information notice;

3.6CA.6.d

for the amount of any financial penalty imposed on a person by virtue of
paragraph  (c)  to be determined by the Authority in accordance with tender
regulations.

3.6CA.7

Where by virtue of  subsection (6) (c)  tender regulations provide for the
imposition of a financial penalty, they must also include provision for a
right of appeal against the imposition of the penalty.

######### Recovery of tender costs

3.6CB

3.6CB.1

Tender regulations may include provision requiring—

3.6CB.1.a

the payment to the Authority or a delivery body, in prescribed circumstances,
of amounts in respect of—

3.6CB.1.a.i

tender costs of the Authority, or of the delivery body, in relation to a
tender exercise;

3.6CB.1.a.ii

such amounts in respect of the Authority’s tender costs as the Authority
considers appropriate, where those costs are not attributable to a particular
tender exercise;

3.6CB.1.a.iii

such amounts in respect of the delivery body’s tender costs as the Authority
considers appropriate, where those costs are not attributable to a particular
tender exercise.

3.6CB.1.b

the provision to the Authority or to a delivery body, in prescribed
circumstances, of a deposit of a prescribed amount in respect of a liability
which a person has, or may in future have, by virtue of paragraph  (a)  in
relation to a relevant licence or relevant contract;

3.6CB.1.c

the provision to the Authority or to a delivery body, in prescribed
circumstances, of security in a form approved by it in respect of such a
liability.

3.6CB.2

The provision that may be made by virtue of subsection  (1) (a)  includes
provision requiring the payment of cost assessment costs incurred by—

3.6CB.2.a

the Authority, or

3.6CB.2.b

the delivery body,

after the Authority or delivery body (as the case may be) has taken the steps
required by virtue of subsections  (7)  to  (9)  in relation to the tender
exercise.

3.6CB.3

The regulations may require the payments to be made, or the deposit or
security to be provided, by one or more of the following—

3.6CB.3.a

any person who has made a connection request for the purposes of which the
tender exercise has been, is being, or is to be, held;

3.6CB.3.b

any person who made a connection request for the purposes of which any
previous tender exercise relating to the same transmission system, or a
transmission system consisting of some or all of the same lines or plant or
connecting any of the same generating stations or substations, was held;

3.6CB.3.c

any person who made a connection request for the purposes of which any
previous tender exercise relating to the same distribution system, or a
distribution system consisting of some or all of the same lines or plant or
connecting any of same premises or other distribution systems, was held;

3.6CB.3.d

any person who operates a generating station which is connected to the
transmission or distribution system to which the tender exercise relates;

3.6CB.3.e

any person who submits an application for the relevant licence or bids for the
award of a relevant contract to which the tender exercise relates;

3.6CB.3.f

any person who is the holder of a transmission licence, a distribution
licence, an interconnector licence or an MPI licence.

3.6CB.4

The regulations may make provision about how—

3.6CB.4.a

payments are to be made, and

3.6CB.4.b

deposits or other forms of security are to be provided,

including provision for them to be made or provided by a person approved by
the Authority or by a delivery body.

3.6CB.5

The regulations may include provision about—

3.6CB.5.a

the times at which payments are to be made, or deposits or other forms of
security are to be provided, under the regulations;

3.6CB.5.b

the circumstances in which a payment made in accordance with regulations made
by virtue of subsection  (1) (a)  is to be repaid (wholly or in part);

3.6CB.5.c

the circumstances in which such a repayment is to include an amount
representing interest accrued on the whole or part of the payment;

3.6CB.5.d

the circumstances in which a deposit (including any interest accrued on it) or
other security provided in accordance with the regulations is to be released
or forfeited (wholly or in part);

3.6CB.5.e

the effect on a person’s participation in the tender exercise of a failure to
comply with a requirement imposed by virtue of this section, and the
circumstances in which the tender exercise is to stop as a result of such a
failure.

3.6CB.6

The regulations may include provision for—

3.6CB.6.a

the review by the Authority, or by a person appointed by the Authority, of any
tender costs determined by a delivery body;

3.6CB.6.b

the amendment by a delivery body of its tender costs following such a review.

3.6CB.7

The regulations must ensure that, as soon as reasonably practicable after a
tender exercise or series of tender exercises is finished—

3.6CB.7.a

where the Authority is the delivery body, steps are taken by the Authority, in
accordance with the regulations, to ensure that the aggregate of the amounts
in subsection  (9)  does not exceed the Authority’s tender costs in respect of
the exercise or series of exercises;

3.6CB.7.b

in any other case, steps are taken by the delivery body, in accordance with
the regulations, to ensure that the aggregate of the amounts in subsection
(9)  does not exceed the aggregate of—

3.6CB.7.b.i

the Authority’s tender costs, and

3.6CB.7.b.ii

the delivery body’s tender costs,

in respect of the exercise or series of exercises.

3.6CB.8

The regulations must also ensure that, in a case within subsection  (7) (b) ,
the aggregate of the amounts within subsection  (9)  so far as relating to any
particular tender exercise does not include any amount that falls within
paragraph (a) of the definition of tender costs in section  6CD (4)  in
relation to a different tender exercise.

3.6CB.9

The amounts are—

3.6CB.9.a

any fees under section 6A(2) in respect of applications for relevant licences,

3.6CB.9.b

any payments made or deposits provided in accordance with regulations made by
virtue of subsection  (1) (a)  or  (b)  and not repaid, and

3.6CB.9.c

the value of any security provided in accordance with regulations made by
virtue of subsection  (1) (c)  and forfeited in accordance with regulations
made by virtue of subsection  (5) (d) ,

so far as relating to the tender exercise or series of tender exercises in
question.

######### Competitive tenders: supplementary

3.6CC

3.6CC.1

For the purposes of section  6CB (3) , a person makes a connection request
when the person makes an application to—

3.6CC.1.a

the holder of a co-ordination licence (in accordance with any provision made
by the licence) for an offer of connection to and use of a transmission
system, or

3.6CC.1.b

an electricity distributor (whether in accordance with any provision made by
the distributor’s licence or otherwise) for an offer of connection to and use
of the distributor’s distribution system.

3.6CC.2

A person (“ P ”) is to be treated for those purposes as having made a
connection request if—

3.6CC.2.a

P would have made the connection request, but for the fact that another person
had already made an application within subsection  (1) (a)  or  (b) , and

3.6CC.2.b

the benefit of that application, or any agreement resulting from it, is vested
in P.

3.6CC.3

Where tender regulations—

3.6CC.3.a

restrict the making of applications for relevant licences or bids for relevant
contracts in relation to a relevant electricity project, or

3.6CC.3.b

operate so as to prevent an application or bid from being considered or
further considered, if the applicant does not meet one or more prescribed
requirements,

the regulations may make provision enabling a person to apply to a relevant
body for a decision as to the effect of any such restriction or requirement if
the person were to make such an application or bid.

3.6CC.4

Regulations made by virtue of subsection  (3)  may enable a relevant body to
charge a person who makes such an application or bid a prescribed fee for any
decision given in response to it.

3.6CC.5

Where the successful bidder, in relation to a tender exercise, already holds a
relevant licence (“ the existing licence ”)—

3.6CC.5.a

the Authority may make such modifications of the existing licence as are
necessary for the purpose of giving effect to the determination resulting from
the tender exercise, and

3.6CC.5.b

references in this Part to the grant of a relevant licence are to be read
accordingly.

3.6CC.6

Before making any modifications under subsection  (5) (a) , the Authority must
give notice—

3.6CC.6.a

stating that it proposes to make the modifications and setting out their
effect, and

3.6CC.6.b

specifying the time (not being less than 28 days from the date of publication
of the notice) within which representations or objections with respect to the
proposed modifications may be made,

and must consider any representations or objections that are duly made and not
withdrawn.

3.6CC.7

Any sums received by the Authority under tender regulations are to be paid
into the Consolidated Fund.

3.6CC.8

In section  6CB  and this section—

      “ co-ordination licence ” means a transmission licence which authorises
a person to co-ordinate and direct the flow of electricity onto and over a
transmission system—         by means of which the transmission of electricity
takes place, and           the whole or a part of which is at a relevant place
(within the meaning of section 4(5));                 “ functions ” includes
powers and duties;           “ relevant body ” means the Authority, a delivery
body or a contract counterparty.

######### Sections 

3.6CD

3.6CD.1

This section defines expressions that are used in sections  6C  to  6CC  (as
well as in this section).

3.6CD.2

“ Prescribed ” means prescribed in or determined under tender regulations.

3.6CD.3

“ Tender exercise ” means the steps taken in accordance with tender
regulations with a view to determining one or more of the following—

3.6CD.3.a

the person by whom a relevant electricity project is to be carried out;

3.6CD.3.b

the person to whom a relevant licence is to be granted;

3.6CD.3.c

the person to whom a relevant contract is to be awarded.

3.6CD.4

“ Tender costs ” means—

3.6CD.4.a

costs (including any cost assessment costs) incurred or likely to be incurred
by the Authority for the purposes of a particular tender exercise or
prospective tender exercise;

3.6CD.4.b

costs (including any cost assessment costs) incurred or likely to be incurred
by a delivery body for the purposes of a particular tender exercise or
prospective tender exercise;

3.6CD.4.c

such proportion as the Authority considers appropriate of the costs that—

3.6CD.4.c.i

have been, or are likely to be, incurred by the Authority or by a delivery
body under regulations under section  6C , and

3.6CD.4.c.ii

are not directly attributable to a particular tender exercise.

3.6CD.5

“ Cost assessment costs ”, in relation to a tender exercise, means costs
incurred or likely to be incurred by the Authority or by a delivery body in
connection with any assessment of—

3.6CD.5.a

costs that have been or are to be incurred in connection with any property,
rights or liabilities necessary or expedient for the performance by a person
of functions under a relevant licence granted or a relevant contract awarded
to the person as a result of the tender exercise;

3.6CD.5.b

costs incurred in connection with any property, rights or liabilities that
would have been necessary or expedient for the performance of functions under
a relevant licence or a relevant contract if such a licence or contract had
been granted or awarded to a person as a result of the tender exercise.

3.6CD.6

“ Successful bidder ”, in relation to a tender exercise, is the person in
respect of whom (as a result of the exercise) any of the following applies—

3.6CD.6.a

a delivery body determines that a relevant electricity project is to be
carried out by the person;

3.6CD.6.b

a relevant licence has been or is to be granted to the person;

3.6CD.6.c

a relevant contract has been or is to be awarded to the person.

3.6CD.7

Section  6C (8)  applies for the purposes of subsections  (3) (b)  and  (c)
and  (6) (b)  and  (c)  as it applies for the purposes of section  6C (2) (b)
and  (c) .

######### Transmission owner and distribution network owner of last resort

23.36A

23.36A.1

Before directing the holder of a transmission licence to act as a transmission
owner of last resort pursuant to the conditions of the licence, the Authority
may publish a notice—

23.36A.1.a

stating that it proposes to give the direction, and

23.36A.1.b

identifying the licence holder to whom it proposes to give the direction.

23.36A.2

Where a notice is published under sub-paragraph  (1) , this Schedule has
effect as if—

23.36A.2.a

the licence holder is the preferred bidder in relation to a tender exercise,
and

23.36A.2.b

the notice is one published under paragraph 35(2), identifying the licence
holder as the preferred bidder.

23.36A.3

Paragraph 35(4) applies in relation to a notice published under sub-paragraph
(1)  of this paragraph as it applies to a notice published under paragraph
35(2).

23.36A.4

Where the Authority directs the holder of a transmission licence to act as a
transmission owner of last resort pursuant to the conditions of the licence,
this Schedule has effect as if—

23.36A.4.a

the licence holder is the holder of a transmission licence granted as a result
of a tender exercise in which the licence holder was the successful bidder,
and

23.36A.4.b

a notice has been published under paragraph 36 identifying the licence holder
as the successful bidder in relation to the tender exercise.

23.36B

23.36B.1

Authority may publish a notice—

23.36B.1.a

stating that it proposes to give the direction, and

23.36B.1.b

identifying the licence holder to whom it proposes to give the direction.

23.36B.2

effect as if—

23.36B.2.a

the licence holder is the preferred bidder in relation to a tender exercise,
and

23.36B.2.b

the notice is one published under paragraph 35(2), identifying the licence
holder as the preferred bidder.

23.36B.3

Paragraph 35(4) applies in relation to a notice published under sub-paragraph
(1)  of this paragraph as it applies to a notice published under paragraph
35(2).

23.36B.4

Where the Authority directs the holder of a distribution licence to act as a
distribution network owner of last resort pursuant to the conditions of the
licence, this Schedule has effect as if—

23.36B.4.a

the licence holder is the holder of a distribution licence granted as a result

23.36B.4.b

  Mergers of energy network enterprises

Section 204

##### Further duties of Competition and Markets Authority to make references

1

Part 3 of the Enterprise Act 2002 (mergers) is amended as follows.

2

After section 68 insert—

######### Mergers of energy network enterprises in Great Britain

########## Relevant merger situations involving energy network mergers

2.68A

2.68A.1

For the purposes of this Part, a relevant merger situation involves an energy
network merger if two or more of the enterprises that cease to be distinct are
energy network enterprises of the same type.

2.68A.2

For the purposes of this Part, the types of “energy network enterprise” are—

2.68A.2.a

an enterprise holding a licence under section 7 of the Gas Act 1986 (gas
transporter);

2.68A.2.b

an enterprise holding a licence under section 6(1)(b) of the Electricity Act
1989 (transmission of electricity), except as mentioned in subsection  (3) ;

2.68A.2.c

an enterprise holding a licence under section 6(1)(c) of the Electricity Act
1989 (distribution of electricity), except as mentioned in subsection  (3) .

2.68A.3

An enterprise holding a licence under section 6(1)(b) or (c) of the
Electricity Act 1989 is not an energy network enterprise if—

2.68A.3.a

the licence was granted following a tender exercise, and

2.68A.3.b

either—

2.68A.3.b.i

the enterprise does not hold any other licence of a type mentioned in
subsection  (2) , or

2.68A.3.b.ii

the enterprise holds one or more other licences under section 6(1)(b) or (c)
of the Electricity Act 1989 and each of those other licences was granted
following a tender exercise.

2.68A.4

The Secretary of State may by regulations amend this section by—

2.68A.4.a

adding to subsection  (2)  an enterprise holding a licence under the Gas Act
1986 or the Electricity Act 1989 of a type that is not specified in that
subsection;

2.68A.4.b

creating an exception in relation to a type of enterprise specified in
subsection  (2) ;

2.68A.4.c

amending or removing an exception that applies in relation to a type of
enterprise specified in subsection  (2) .

2.68A.5

Before making regulations under subsection  (4) , the Secretary of State must
consult—

2.68A.5.a

the Gas and Electricity Markets Authority, and

2.68A.5.b

the CMA.

2.68A.6

In this section, “ tender exercise ” has the same meaning as in section 6CD of
the Electricity Act 1989.

########## Further duty to make references in relation to completed mergers

2.68B

2.68B.1

The CMA must make a reference to its chair for the constitution of a group
under Schedule 4 to the Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Act 2013 if the CMA
believes that it is or may be the case that—

2.68B.1.a

a relevant merger situation involving an energy network merger has been
created, and

2.68B.1.b

the creation of that situation has caused, or may be expected to cause,
substantial prejudice to the ability of the Gas and Electricity Markets
Authority, in carrying out its functions under Part 1 of the Gas Act 1986 or
Part 1 of the Electricity Act 1989, to make comparisons between energy network
enterprises of the type involved in the energy network merger;

but this is subject to subsections  (2)  and  (3) .

2.68B.2

The CMA may decide not to make a reference under this section if it believes
that any relevant customer benefits in relation to the creation of the
relevant merger situation outweigh the prejudice mentioned in subsection  (1)
(b) .

2.68B.3

The CMA must not make a reference under this section in any circumstances
described in section 22(3).

2.68B.4

A reference under this section must, in particular, specify—

2.68B.4.a

the enactment under which it is made, and

2.68B.4.b

the date on which it is made.

########## Further duty to make references in relation to anticipated mergers

2.68C

2.68C.1

The CMA must make a reference to its chair for the constitution of a group
under Schedule 4 to the Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Act 2013 if the CMA
believes that it is or may be the case that—

2.68C.1.a

arrangements are in progress or in contemplation which, if carried into
effect, will result in the creation of a relevant merger situation involving
an energy network merger, and

2.68C.1.b

the creation of that situation may be expected to cause substantial prejudice
to the ability of the Gas and Electricity Markets Authority, in carrying out
its functions under Part 1 of the Gas Act 1986 or Part 1 of the Electricity
Act 1989, to make comparisons between energy network enterprises of the type
involved in the energy network merger,

but this is subject to subsections  (2)  and  (3) .

2.68C.2

The CMA may decide not to make a reference under this section if it believes
that—

2.68C.2.a

the arrangements concerned are not sufficiently far advanced, or are not
sufficiently likely to proceed, to justify the making of a reference, or

2.68C.2.b

any relevant customer benefits in relation to the creation of the relevant
merger situation concerned outweigh the prejudice mentioned in subsection  (1)
(b) .

2.68C.3

The CMA must not make a reference under this section in any circumstances
described in section 33(3).

2.68C.4

A reference under this section must, in particular, specify—

2.68C.4.a

the enactment under which it is made, and

2.68C.4.b

the date on which it is made.

########## Opinion of the Gas and Electricity Markets Authority

2.68D

2.68D.1

Before forming a view for the purposes of section  68B (1) (b)  or  (2)  or
68C (1) (b)  or  (2) (b) , the CMA must—

2.68D.1.a

ask the Gas and Electricity Markets Authority to give an opinion, and

2.68D.1.b

consider that opinion.

2.68D.2

Where the CMA makes a request under this section, the Gas and Electricity
Markets Authority must give its opinion on—

2.68D.2.a

whether and to what extent the creation of the relevant merger situation has
prejudiced, or may be expected to prejudice, the Authority’s ability, in
carrying out its functions under Part 1 of the Gas Act 1986 or Part 1 of the
Electricity Act 1989, to make comparisons between energy network enterprises
of the type involved in the relevant merger situation, and

2.68D.2.b

whether any prejudice is outweighed by any relevant customer benefits in
relation to the creation of the relevant merger situation.

2.68D.3

The Gas and Electricity Markets Authority must prepare and publish a statement
of the methods it considers should be applied in forming an opinion on the
matters mentioned in subsection (2).

2.68D.4

The statement must, in particular, set out—

2.68D.4.a

the criteria to be used for assessing the effect of any particular energy
network enterprises ceasing to be distinct enterprises on the Gas and
Electricity Market Authority’s ability to make comparisons between such
enterprises, and

2.68D.4.b

the relative weight to be given to the criteria.

2.68D.5

Before preparing or altering the statement, the Gas and Electricity Markets
Authority must consult—

2.68D.5.a

the Secretary of State,

2.68D.5.b

the Scottish Ministers,

2.68D.5.c

the Welsh Ministers,

2.68D.5.d

the CMA, and

2.68D.5.e

each energy network enterprise.

2.68D.6

The Gas and Electricity Markets Authority must from time to time—

2.68D.6.a

review the statement, and

2.68D.6.b

where appropriate, change the statement and publish the new version.

2.68D.7

In forming its opinion under this section, the Gas and Electricity Markets
Authority must apply the methods set out in its latest statement.

########## Combined references

2.68E

2.68E.1

In respect of a relevant merger situation involving an energy network merger,
the CMA may—

2.68E.1.a

make a reference under both section 22 and section  68B , or

2.68E.1.b

make a reference under both section 33 and section  68C .

2.68E.2

If the CMA does so—

2.68E.2.a

the references may be decided by the same group constituted under Schedule 4
to the Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Act 2013;

2.68E.2.b

the functions of the CMA referred to in section 34C(1) and (2) may be carried
out on behalf of the CMA by the same group in relation to both references; and

2.68E.2.c

the group’s duties under section 38 to prepare and publish a report on each
reference may be satisfied by preparing and publishing a single report on both
references.

########## Modification of this Part

2.68F

2.68F.1

In relation to—

2.68F.1.a

a reference, or possible reference, under section  68B , and

2.68F.1.b

a reference, or possible reference, under section  68C ,

Chapter 1 of this Part applies with the modifications set out in Schedule 5A.

2.68F.2

In Chapters 2 to 5 of this Part, references to a provision of Chapter 1
include that provision as applied by subsection  (1)  and Schedule 5A.

.

Heat networks regulation

Section 219

##### Interpretation

1

In this Schedule—

“ code manager licence ” has the meaning given by  paragraph 25 ; “ consumer
redress order ” has the meaning given by  paragraph 37 ; “ designated document
” has the meaning given by  paragraph 22 ; “ emissions ” has the same meaning
as in the Climate Change Act 2008 (see section 97 of that Act); “ enforcement
undertaking ” has the meaning given by paragraph  38 (2) ; “ heat network
authorisation ” has the meaning given by  paragraph 13 ; “ heat network
consumer ” has the meaning given by the regulations; “ installation and
maintenance licence ” has the meaning given by  paragraph 31 ; “ licensed code
manager ”, in relation to a designated document, has the meaning given by
paragraph 25 ; “ regulated activity ” has the meaning given by  paragraph 12 ;
“ the regulations ” means regulations under  section 219 ; “ relevant
condition ” has the meaning given by  paragraph 37 ; “ relevant person ” has
the meaning given by  paragraph 37 ; “ relevant requirement ” has the meaning
given by paragraph  37 ; “ targeted greenhouse gas ” has the same meaning as
in Part 1 of the Climate Change Act 2008 (see section 24 of that Act).

##### General provision as to the Regulator

###### Objectives

2

2.1

The regulations may make provision about the objectives of the Regulator in
carrying out its functions under the regulations.

2.2

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular, provide
that the principal objective of the Regulator is to protect the interests of
existing and future heat network consumers.

2.3

The regulations may specify particular interests of existing and future heat
network consumers that are to be protected.

2.4

The interests specified may, in particular, include—

2.4.a

their interests in the reliability of the supply of heating, cooling or hot
water by means of relevant heat networks;

2.4.b

their interests in the reduction of emissions of targeted greenhouse gases
generated by relevant heat networks;

2.4.c

their interests in charges for the supply of heating, cooling or hot water by
means of relevant heat networks being proportionate;

2.4.d

their interests in information about services and charges being communicated
plainly.

###### General duties

3

3.1

The regulations may make provision about the duties of the Regulator in
carrying out its functions under the regulations.

3.2

The duties may, in particular, include—

3.2.a

a duty to carry out its functions in a manner best calculated to further its
objectives;

3.2.b

a duty to consider, when carrying out its functions, the need to ensure that
persons carrying out activities under a heat network authorisation or under an
installation and maintenance licence are able to finance obligations imposed
by or under the regulations;

3.2.c

a duty to have regard to the interests of heat network consumers who are in
vulnerable circumstances when performing duties imposed by regulations made by
virtue of  paragraph (a)  or  (b) .

3.3

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (2) (a)  may require that the
Regulator promote effective competition between persons engaged in, or in
commercial activities connected with, the supply of heating, cooling or hot
water by means of relevant heat networks.

4

4.1

The regulations may provide for the Regulator to have regard, in carrying out
a function under the regulations, to—

4.1.a

the interests of existing and future consumers in relation to electricity
conveyed by distribution systems or transmission systems (within the meaning
of the Electricity Act 1989);

4.1.b

the interests of existing and future consumers in relation to gas conveyed
through pipes (within the meaning of the Gas Act 1986);

4.1.c

any interests of existing and future consumers in relation to—

4.1.c.i

communications services and electronic communications apparatus, or

4.1.c.ii

water services or sewerage services (within the meaning of the Water Industry
Act 1991),

which are affected by the carrying out of that function.

4.2

The regulations may provide for persons or bodies exercising regulatory
functions in those fields to have regard, in carrying out a regulatory
function, to the interests of existing or future consumers in relation to the
supply of heating, cooling or hot water by means of relevant heat networks.

###### Delegation of functions

5

5.1

The regulations may provide for the Regulator to delegate functions conferred
on the Regulator by the regulations.

5.2

The regulations may specify functions which may be delegated only with the
consent of the Secretary of State or, as the case may be, the Department.

###### Monitoring, records and information

6

6.1

The regulations may require the Regulator to keep under review the carrying on
of activities connected with heat networks in the part or parts of the United
Kingdom in relation to which the Regulator has functions under the
regulations.

6.2

The regulations may require the Regulator to monitor such matters relating to
the activities regulated by the regulations or the persons who carry on those
activities as the regulations may specify.

6.3

The regulations may, for the purposes of enabling the Regulator to perform a
duty imposed by regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (2) , make
provision enabling the Regulator to require information to be supplied.

7

7.1

The regulations may require the Regulator to collect information with respect
to activities connected with heat networks and the persons who carry on those
activities for such purposes as are specified in the regulations.

7.2

The regulations may, in particular, require the Regulator to collect
information relating to standards of performance achieved by—

7.2.a

persons who hold a heat network authorisation;

7.2.b

licensed code managers;

7.2.c

persons who hold an installation and maintenance licence.

8

8.1

The regulations may make provision requiring the Regulator to maintain
records.

8.2

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular, make
provision requiring the Regulator to maintain records relating to—

8.2.a

persons whose application for a heat network authorisation, a code manager
licence or an installation and maintenance licence has been refused;

8.2.b

persons whose heat network authorisation, code manager licence or installation
and maintenance licence has been revoked.

8.3

The regulations may make provision enabling or requiring the Regulator to
provide information from its records to—

8.3.a

the Secretary of State or a person specified by the Secretary of State,

8.3.b

the Department or a person specified by the Department, or

8.3.c

the Scottish Ministers or a person specified by the Scottish Ministers.

9

9.1

The regulations may make provision restricting the disclosure of information
obtained by the Regulator under or by virtue of the regulations, subject to
exceptions specified in the regulations.

9.2

The regulations may make provision about the disclosure to the Regulator of
information held by other persons or bodies.

10

10.1

The regulations may make provision for the purpose of securing that a
disclosure of information which is authorised or required by the regulations
does not contravene the data protection legislation.

10.2

In this paragraph, “ the data protection legislation ” has the same meaning as
in the Data Protection Act 2018 (see section 3(9) of that Act).

###### Other general provision

11

11.1

The regulations may make other general provision about the Regulator.

11.2

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular, make
provision about—

11.2.a

preparing and publishing documents about—

11.2.a.i

strategy and policies;

11.2.a.ii

plans for future work;

11.2.b

publishing reports annually;

11.2.c

publishing financial information in annual accounts;

11.2.d

preparing and publishing impact assessments.

11.3

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may make provision about
preparing, issuing, reviewing and revising guidance.

11.4

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may provide for the
publication of information and advice for the purpose of promoting the
interests of existing and future heat network consumers.

##### Heat network authorisations

###### Prohibition from carrying on regulated activity

12

12.1

The regulations may prohibit a person from carrying on a regulated activity,
except as permitted by virtue of an authorisation conferred under regulations
made by virtue of  paragraph 13 .

12.2

In this paragraph, “ regulated activity ” means an activity relating to a
relevant heat network of such description as may be specified in the
regulations.

###### Heat network authorisations

13

13.1

The regulations may provide for the Regulator to confer authorisations (“heat
network authorisations”) to carry on one or more regulated activities
specified in the authorisation in relation to a particular relevant heat
network.

13.2

The regulations may require a person who applies for a heat network
authorisation—

13.2.a

to satisfy such conditions relating to the person, the regulated activity or
activities in question or the relevant heat network in question as the
regulations may specify, and

13.2.b

to provide such information as the regulations may specify.

13.3

The regulations may provide for the Regulator—

13.3.a

to confer a heat network authorisation;

13.3.b

to confer a heat network authorisation on a temporary basis;

13.3.c

to refuse to confer a heat network authorisation.

13.4

The regulations may make provision about the procedure for applying for a heat
network authorisation, including provision about—

13.4.a

the form and content of an application,

13.4.b

the manner in which the application and any accompanying documents are to be
submitted to the Regulator;

13.4.c

the payment of a fee.

13.5

Regulations made in relation to England and Wales and Scotland by virtue of
sub-paragraph (2) (b)  or  (4)  may provide for the Regulator to make
provision by regulations about the matters referred to in that sub-paragraph.

13.6

Regulations made by the Regulator by virtue of  sub-paragraph (5)  are to be
made by statutory instrument.

13.7

The regulations may make provision as to the period for which an authorisation
may be in force.

14

14.1

The regulations may make provision about the conditions to be included in heat
network authorisations.

14.2

The regulations may, in particular—

14.2.a

provide for the Regulator to determine and publish conditions to be included
in each heat network authorisation or in each heat network authorisation of a
particular description;

14.2.b

provide for the Secretary of State or, in relation to Northern Ireland, the
Department to determine and publish conditions to be included in each heat
network authorisation or in each heat network authorisation of a particular
description;

14.2.c

provide for consultation on, and publication of, the conditions proposed to be
so determined;

14.2.d

make provision about the inclusion in a heat network authorisation of
conditions that are special to that authorisation;

14.2.e

make provision about including conditions that meet objectives or other
criteria specified in the regulations.

14.3

The regulations may, in particular, provide for conditions to be included in a
heat network authorisation requiring the person who holds the authorisation—

14.3.a

to comply with the provisions of a particular designated document;

14.3.b

to enter into governance arrangements with the person who is from time to time
the licensed code manager for that designated document and to comply with
those arrangements;

14.3.c

to provide funding for the person who is from time to time the licensed code
manager for that designated document.

14.4

The regulations may, in particular, provide for the following sorts of
conditions to be included in a heat network authorisation—

14.4.a

conditions about the terms on which premises are connected to a relevant heat
network (whether for the purpose of supplying heating, cooling or hot water to
premises, or supplying thermal energy to a relevant heat network);

14.4.b

conditions about installing and maintaining equipment for measuring,
displaying, recording and regulating consumption of heating, cooling and hot
water supplied by means of relevant heat networks;

14.4.c

conditions about—

14.4.c.i

the charges payable by heat network consumers or a description of heat network
consumers specified in the regulations,

14.4.c.ii

the billing of heat network consumers;

14.4.c.iii

service standards, or

14.4.c.iv

the communication of information about the heat network, the services provided
or the terms on which the services are provided;

14.4.d

conditions relating to price regulation (including by means of regulation of
charges or profits);

14.4.e

conditions about complying with technical standards (including, in relation to
England and Wales and Scotland, technical standards for which provision is
made in a designated document);

14.4.f

conditions about ensuring the continuity of the supply of heating, cooling and
hot water to heat network consumers;

14.4.g

conditions about limiting emissions of targeted greenhouse gases in relation
to relevant heat networks in England or Northern Ireland;

14.4.h

conditions about providing information to the Regulator;

14.4.i

conditions about the payment of fees to the Regulator, including conditions
about the payment of fees—

14.4.i.i

in connection with the conferring of an authorisation;

14.4.i.ii

while an authorisation continues to be in force in relation to a person;

14.4.j

conditions about making payments to the Regulator of sums relating to the
costs of the Regulator under regulations made by virtue of  paragraph 46 (2) .

14.5

Conditions of the sort referred to in  sub-paragraph (4) (c) (i)  may, in
particular—

14.5.a

provide for charges imposed on heat network consumers to be subject to a price
cap;

14.5.b

require a person who holds a heat network authorisation not to impose on heat
network consumers charges that are disproportionate (see  paragraph 42 ).

14.6

Conditions of the sort referred to in  sub-paragraph (4) (c) (ii)  may, in
particular—

14.6.a

impose requirements about the bills given to heat network consumers (including
requirements about their frequency, accuracy and the use of estimates);

14.6.b

impose requirements about the information and explanatory material to be
provided to heat network consumers;

14.6.c

make provision about the charges that may be made in respect of the costs of
providing bills and such information and explanatory material.

14.7

The regulations may, in particular, provide for conditions to be included in a
heat network authorisation that—

14.7.a

in relation to England and Wales or Scotland, impose on the person who holds
the authorisation a requirement of a kind that may be imposed under section
7(3) of the Electricity Act 1989 on the holder of a licence under section 6(1)
of that Act;

14.7.b

in relation to Northern Ireland, impose on the person who holds the
authorisation a requirement of a kind that may be imposed under Article 11(3)
of the Electricity (Northern Ireland) Order 1992 ( S.I. 1992/231 (N.I. 1))  on
the holder of a licence under Article 10(1) of that Order.

###### Conditions about technical standards: further provision

15

The technical standards for which regulations made by virtue of  paragraph 14
(4) (e)  may make provision include technical standards relating to—

15.a

the design, construction, commissioning, operation or maintenance of a heat
network;

15.b

the decommissioning of a heat network;

15.c

equipment or materials used in the construction, operation or maintenance of a
heat network;

15.d

the competence of persons engaged in the design, construction, commissioning,
operation or maintenance of a heat network.

###### Conditions about continuity of supply: further provision

16

Conditions of the sort referred to in  paragraph 14 (4) (f)  may, in
particular, require the holder of a heat network authorisation to enter into
and maintain contractual arrangements under which, in circumstances of a
description specified in the conditions, one or more other persons are under
an obligation to secure the continuity of the supply of heating, cooling or
hot water.

17

Conditions of the sort referred to in  paragraph 14 (4) (f)  may, in
particular, require the holder of a heat network authorisation, when directed
to do so by the Regulator in circumstances of a description specified in the
conditions, to carry on a regulated activity in relation to a relevant heat
network in the place of another person (see  paragraph 44 ).

###### Modification of heat network authorisations

18

18.1

The regulations may provide for the modification by the Regulator of—

18.1.a

the conditions of a particular heat network authorisation;

18.1.b

conditions that are included in two or more heat network authorisations.

18.2

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular—

18.2.a

provide for the procedure to be followed by the Regulator when it proposes to
make a modification;

18.2.b

provide for the communication of any modification;

18.2.c

provide for the time when any modification takes effect;

18.2.d

provide for the Regulator to comply with a direction of the Secretary of State
or, in relation to Northern Ireland, the Department not to make a particular
modification.

18.3

In sub-paragraphs  (1)  and  (2) , a reference to the modification of a
condition includes a reference to the revocation of a condition.

18.4

The regulations may provide for the conditions of a heat network
authorisation—

18.4.a

to have effect or cease to have effect at such times and in such circumstances
as may be determined by or under the conditions;

18.4.b

to be modified in such manner as may be specified in the conditions at such
times and in such circumstances as may be so determined.

###### Review and revocation of heat network authorisations

19

The regulations may provide for the conditions of, or the activities carried
out by virtue of, a heat network authorisation to be reviewed by the Regulator
at any time while it is in force.

20

20.1

The regulations may provide—

20.1.a

for the revocation of a heat network authorisation by the Regulator;

20.1.b

for a heat network authorisation to cease to have effect in circumstances
specified in or determined under the authorisation.

20.2

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1) (a)  may, in particular,
provide for the procedure to be followed by the Regulator when it proposes to
revoke the authorisation.

###### Initial period

21

21.1

The regulations may make provision with respect to persons carrying on a
regulated activity in relation to a relevant heat network during a period
that—

21.1.a

begins with the day on which any regulations made by virtue of  paragraph 12
come into force, and

21.1.b

ends with a day specified in the regulations.

21.2

The regulations may—

21.2.a

provide for the period to be prolonged, or to be prolonged as it relates to a
description of heat network authorisations, by the Regulator;

21.2.b

require the consent of the Secretary of State or the Department (as the case
may be) to such an alteration.

21.3

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may—

21.3.a

provide for a person carrying on a regulated activity in relation to a
relevant heat network to be treated as holding a heat network authorisation in
relation to that activity and that relevant heat network during the period
described in  sub-paragraph (1)  (or, if applicable, during that period as
prolonged by virtue of  sub-paragraph (2) );

21.3.b

make provision as to the conditions of the heat network authorisation treated
as conferred on such a person (including provision similar to the provision
described in  paragraph 14 (2) );

21.3.c

require a person carrying on a regulated activity in relation to a relevant
heat network to apply to the Regulator for a heat network authorisation to be
conferred on the person by a time specified in or determined under the
regulations.

21.4

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (3) (c)  may provide for
different times for different descriptions of case.

##### Code governance

###### Designated documents

22

22.1

In  this Part , “ designated document ” means a document that—

22.1.a

is maintained in accordance with the conditions of a code manager licence, and

22.1.b

is designated for the purposes of  this Part  by or in accordance with the
regulations.

22.2

The regulations may—

22.2.a

designate or provide for the designation of different documents for different
purposes;

22.2.b

provide for the time from which a designation has effect;

22.2.c

provide for the modification of a designated document and its reissuing in its
modified form;

22.2.d

revoke or provide for the revocation of a designated document;

22.2.e

provide for a designated document otherwise ceasing to be a designated
document.

22.3

The regulations may provide for a document that is designated to make
provision by reference to material (including standards, specifications or
requirements) contained in other documents that are published from time to
time.

22.4

The regulations may, in particular, make provision about the cases in which
the designated document may be modified by the Regulator.

###### Prohibition on performing the function of a code manager

23

23.1

The regulations may, in relation to England and Wales and Scotland, prohibit a
person from performing the function of code manager in relation to a
designated document, except as permitted by virtue of a code manager licence
(see  paragraph 25 ).

23.2

A reference in  this Part  to a person performing the function of code manager
in relation to a designated document is a reference to a person making
arrangements, with persons to whom  sub-paragraph (3)  applies, under which
the person is responsible for the governance of the designated document.

23.3

This sub-paragraph applies to the person who holds a heat network
authorisation where a condition of the authorisation requires the person to
comply with the designated document in question.

###### Licensed code managers

24

24.1

The regulations may, in relation to England and Wales and Scotland, make
provision about selecting a person to be a code manager in relation to a
designated document.

24.2

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular, make
provision about the procedure for selecting a person, including provision for
determining which procedure to apply in a particular case.

24.3

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (2)  may include provision for
the payment of a fee by a person seeking to be selected to be a code manager.

24.4

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (2)  may provide for the
Regulator to make provision by regulations about those matters.

24.5

Regulations made by the Regulator by virtue of  sub-paragraph (4)  are to be
made by statutory instrument.

25

25.1

The regulations may, in relation to England and Wales and Scotland, provide
for the Regulator, where a person is selected to be the code manager in
relation to a designated document, to issue a licence (a “code manager
licence”) to the person which authorises the person to perform the function of
code manager in relation to the designated document.

25.2

The regulations may make provision as to the period for which a licence may be
in force.

25.3

In  this Part , references to the licensed code manager, in relation to a
designated document, are references to the person who is authorised by a code
manager licence to perform the function of code manager in relation to the
designated document.

26

26.1

The regulations may make provision about the contents of a code manager
licence.

26.2

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular—

26.2.a

provide for the Regulator to determine and publish conditions to be included
in each code manager licence or in each code manager licence of a particular
description;

26.2.b

provide for the Secretary of State to determine and publish conditions to be
included in each code manager licence or in each code manager licence of a
particular description;

26.2.c

provide for consultation on, and publication of, the conditions proposed to be
so determined;

26.2.d

make provision about the inclusion in a code manager licence of conditions
that are special to that licence;

26.2.e

make provision about including conditions that meet objectives or other
criteria specified in the regulations.

26.3

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular, provide
for the following sorts of conditions to be included in a code manager
licence—

26.3.a

conditions about the nature of the governance arrangements that the licensed
code manager may enter into with persons who hold a heat network authorisation
(see  paragraph 14 (3) (b) );

26.3.b

conditions about the content of those governance arrangements, which may
include provision about the licensed code manager—

26.3.b.i

modifying the designated document,

26.3.b.ii

monitoring or enforcing compliance with the provisions of the designated
document, or

26.3.b.iii

developing guidance relating to the designated document;

26.3.c

conditions about functions of the Regulator in connection with the
modification of a designated document;

26.3.d

conditions about providing information to the Regulator;

26.3.e

conditions about complying with directions of the Regulator as to matters
specified or of a description specified in the code manager licence;

26.3.f

conditions about the payment of fees to the Regulator, including conditions
about the payment of fees—

26.3.f.i

when a code manager licence is first issued;

26.3.f.ii

while a code manager licence continues to be in force in relation to a person.

26.4

The regulations may, in particular, provide for conditions to be included in a
code manager licence that—

26.4.a

in relation to England and Wales or Scotland, impose on the person who holds
the licence a requirement of a kind that may be imposed under section 7(3) of
the Electricity Act 1989 on the holder of a licence under section 6(1) of that
Act;

26.4.b

in relation to Northern Ireland, impose on the person who holds the licence a
requirement of a kind that may be imposed under Article 11(3) of the
Electricity (Northern Ireland) Order 1992 ( S.I. 1992/231 (N.I. 1))  on the
holder of a licence under Article 10(1) of that Order.

27

The regulations may provide for the Regulator to make payments to licensed
code managers in respect of their costs.

28

28.1

The regulations may provide for the modification by the Regulator of—

28.1.a

the conditions of a particular code manager licence;

28.1.b

conditions that are included in two or more code manager licences.

28.2

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular—

28.2.a

provide for the procedure to be followed by the Regulator when it proposes to
make a modification;

28.2.b

provide for the communication of any modification;

28.2.c

provide for the time when any modification takes effect;

28.2.d

provide for the Regulator to comply with a direction of the Secretary of State
not to make a particular modification.

28.3

In sub-paragraphs (1) and (2), a reference to the modification of a condition
includes a reference to the revocation of a condition.

28.4

The regulations may provide for the conditions of a code manager licence—

28.4.a

to have effect or cease to have effect at such times and in such circumstances
as may be determined by or under the conditions;

28.4.b

to be modified in such manner as may be specified in the conditions at such
times and in such circumstances as may be so determined.

###### Review and revocation of code manager licences

29

The regulations may provide for a code manager licence, or the activities
carried out by virtue of a code manager licence, to be reviewed by the
Regulator at any time while it is in force.

30

30.1

The regulations may provide—

30.1.a

for the revocation of a code manager licence by the Regulator;

30.1.b

for a code manager licence to cease to have effect in circumstances specified
in or determined under the licence.

30.2

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1) (a)  may provide for the
procedure to be followed by the Regulator when it proposes to revoke the
licence.

##### Installation and maintenance licences

###### Installation and maintenance licences

31

31.1

The regulations may provide for the issuing of licences (“installation and
maintenance licences”) which authorise the holder of a licence to exercise the
rights specified in the licence for purposes relating to the installation or
maintenance of relevant heat networks—

31.1.a

in England and Wales, or

31.1.b

in Northern Ireland.

31.2

The regulations may require the Regulator to be satisfied before issuing an
installation and maintenance licence to a person that the person is an
appropriate person to hold such a licence.

31.3

The regulations may require the Regulator, in deciding whether a person is an
appropriate person to hold an installation and maintenance licence, to
consider such matters as may be specified.

31.4

The matters specified may, in particular, relate to the abilities or financial
resources of the person applying for a licence or the nature of the business
carried on by the person.

31.5

The regulations may specify other conditions that are to be satisfied before a
licence may be issued.

31.6

The regulations may make provision about the procedure for applying for a
licence, including provision about—

31.6.a

the form and content of an application,

31.6.b

the manner in which the application and any accompanying documents are to be
submitted to the Regulator, and

31.6.c

the payment of a fee.

31.7

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (6)  may provide for the
Regulator to make provision by regulations about the matters referred to in
sub-paragraph (6)  (including provision about the information that must be
provided to the Regulator by a person applying for a licence), so far as
relating to England and Wales.

31.8

Regulations made by the Regulator by virtue of  sub-paragraph (7)  are to be
made by statutory instrument.

31.9

The regulations may make provision as to the period for which a licence may be
in force.

31.10

The regulations may make provision about the transfer of a licence.

###### Rights that may be conferred

32

32.1

The regulations must set out the rights relating to land that are capable of
being conferred on a person by an installation and maintenance licence.

32.2

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  setting out a right may
include provision about the restrictions, exceptions or conditions subject to
which the right may be exercised.

32.3

The rights set out by regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may
include—

32.3.a

a right to apply to the Secretary of State or, in relation to Northern
Ireland, the Department for authority to make a compulsory acquisition of an
easement or other right over land by the creation of a new right for the
purpose of installing or maintaining works and apparatus relating to a heat
network;

32.3.b

a right—

32.3.b.i

to install and keep works and apparatus relating to a heat network in, under
or over a street,

32.3.b.ii

to inspect, maintain, adjust, alter, repair, upgrade, operate or remove such
works and apparatus, and

32.3.b.iii

to carry out such other works as are required for or incidental to those
works,

subject to such requirements as to notification, manner of working and
compensation as may be specified in the regulations;

32.3.c

a right—

32.3.c.i

to install and keep works and apparatus relating to a heat network in, under
or over transport land,

32.3.c.ii

to inspect, maintain, alter, repair, replace and remove such works and
apparatus,

32.3.c.iii

to carry out any works on the transport land for or in connection with the
exercise of a right described in  sub-paragraph (i)  or  (ii) , and

32.3.c.iv

to enter the transport land to inspect, maintain, adjust, alter, repair,
upgrade, operate or remove the works or apparatus,

subject to such requirements as to notification, compensation, arbitration and
alteration of the works and apparatus as may be specified in the regulations;

32.3.d

a right to undertake works of a specified description without being required
to obtain planning permission.

32.4

In this paragraph—

“ street ” means a street in England, Wales or Northern Ireland and— in
relation to England and Wales, has the same meaning as in Part 3 of the New
Roads and Street Works Act 1991; in relation to Northern Ireland, has the same
meaning as in the Street Works (Northern Ireland) Order 1995 ( S.I. 1995/3210
(N.I. 19)) ; “ transport land ” means land which is used wholly or mainly— as
a railway, tramway or waterway, or in connection with a railway, tramway or
waterway on the land.

###### Further provision about installation and maintenance licences

33

33.1

The regulations may make provision about the contents of installation and
maintenance licences.

33.2

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular—

33.2.a

provide for the Regulator to determine and publish conditions to be included
in each installation and maintenance licence or in each installation and
maintenance licence of a particular description;

33.2.b

provide for the Secretary of State or, in relation to Northern Ireland, the
Department to determine and publish conditions to be included in each
installation and maintenance licence or in each installation and maintenance
licence of a particular description;

33.2.c

provide for consultation on, and publication of, the conditions proposed to be
so determined;

33.2.d

make provision about the inclusion in an installation and maintenance licence
of conditions that are special to that licence;

33.2.e

make provision about including conditions that meet objectives or other
criteria specified in the regulations.

33.3

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular, provide
for the following sorts of conditions to be included in a licence—

33.3.a

conditions about providing information to the Regulator;

33.3.b

conditions about the payment of fees to the Regulator, including conditions
about the payment of fees—

33.3.b.i

when a licence is first issued;

33.3.b.ii

while a licence continues to be in force in relation to a person.

33.4

The regulations may, in particular, provide for conditions to be included in
an installation and maintenance licence that—

33.4.a

in relation to England and Wales, impose on the person who holds the licence a
requirement of a kind that may be imposed under section 7(3) of the
Electricity Act 1989 on the holder of a licence under section 6(1) of that
Act;

33.4.b

in relation to Northern Ireland, impose on the person who holds the licence a
requirement of a kind that may be imposed under Article 11(3) of the
Electricity (Northern Ireland) Order 1992 ( S.I. 1992/231 (N.I. 1))  on the
holder of a licence under Article 10(1) of that Order.

34

34.1

The regulations may provide for the modification by the Regulator of—

34.1.a

the conditions of a particular installation and maintenance licence;

34.1.b

conditions that are included in two or more installation and maintenance
licences.

34.2

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular—

34.2.a

provide for the procedure to be followed by the Regulator when it proposes to
make a modification;

34.2.b

provide for the communication of any modification;

34.2.c

provide for the time when any modification takes effect;

34.2.d

provide for the Regulator to comply with a direction of the Secretary of State
or, in relation to Northern Ireland, the Department not to make a particular
modification.

34.3

In sub-paragraphs  (1)  and  (2) , a reference to the modification of a
condition includes a reference to the revocation of a condition.

34.4

The regulations may provide for the conditions of an installation and
maintenance licence—

34.4.a

to have effect or cease to have effect at such times and in such circumstances
as may be determined by or under the conditions;

34.4.b

to be modified in such manner as may be specified in the conditions at such
times and in such circumstances as may be so determined.

###### Review and revocation of installation and maintenance licences

35

The regulations may provide for the conditions of, or the activities carried
out by virtue of, an installation and maintenance licence to be reviewed by
the Regulator at any time while it is in force.

36

36.1

The regulations may provide—

36.1.a

for the revocation of an installation and maintenance licence by the
Regulator;

36.1.b

for an installation and maintenance licence to cease to have effect in
circumstances specified in or determined under the licence.

36.2

Regulations made by virtue of sub-paragraph (1)(a) may, in particular, provide
for the procedure to be followed by the Regulator when it proposes to revoke
the licence.

##### Enforcement of conditions and requirements

###### Methods of enforcement

37

37.1

The regulations may make provision about the enforcement of relevant
conditions or relevant requirements.

37.2

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular, provide
for the Regulator—

37.2.a

in a case where the Regulator is satisfied that a relevant person is
contravening or is likely to contravene a relevant condition or requirement,
to make a final order requiring the person to take such steps as the Regulator
considers appropriate for the purpose of securing the person’s compliance with
the relevant condition or requirement;

37.2.b

in a case where it appears to the Regulator that a relevant person is
contravening or is likely to contravene a relevant condition or requirement,
to make a provisional order requiring the person to take such steps as the
Regulator considers appropriate for the purpose of securing compliance with
the relevant condition or requirement;

37.2.c

to impose a penalty on a relevant person for the contravention of a relevant
condition or requirement;

37.2.d

in relation to England and Wales and Scotland, in a case where the
contravention of a relevant condition or requirement by a relevant person has
caused or is causing one or more consumers to suffer loss or damage or to be
caused inconvenience, to make an order (a “consumer redress order”) requiring
the person to do such things as appear to the Regulator necessary for the
purposes of—

37.2.d.i

remedying the consequences of the contravention, or

37.2.d.ii

preventing the person contravening the relevant condition or requirement again
in the same or a similar way.

37.3

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular, provide
for—

37.3.a

the making of an order,

37.3.b

the imposition of a penalty, or

37.3.c

the making of a consumer redress order,

to be excluded if the Regulator considers that it would be more appropriate to
proceed under the Competition Act 1998 (see  paragraph 41 ).

37.4

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular, make
provision about the use of more than one method of enforcement.

37.5

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular, make
provision about enforcement in a case where a person who holds two or more
heat network authorisations has contravened or is likely to contravene a
relevant condition or requirement in those, or some of those, heat network
authorisations.

37.6

In this paragraph—

“ relevant condition ” means a condition of— a heat network authorisation, a
code manager licence, or an installation and maintenance licence; “ relevant
person ” means— a person who holds a heat network authorisation, a licensed
code manager, or a person who holds an installation and maintenance licence; “
relevant requirement ”, in relation to a relevant person, means a requirement
imposed on the person by or under the regulations or by regulations made by
the Regulator by virtue of any provision of this Schedule.

###### Final and provisional orders

38

38.1

Regulations made by virtue of  paragraph 37 (2)  may, in particular—

38.1.a

provide for the confirmation of a provisional order;

38.1.b

make provision about procedure;

38.1.c

provide for the grounds on which an order may be challenged in legal
proceedings, the time within which it may be challenged and the remedies that
may be given;

38.1.d

specify how an order may be enforced (including by providing for non-
compliance with an order to be a breach of duty);

38.1.e

make provision enabling the Regulator to accept an enforcement undertaking
from a relevant person and about the consequences of accepting such an
undertaking.

38.2

An “enforcement undertaking” is an undertaking to take, within the period
specified in the undertaking, such action as may be so specified to secure
compliance with a relevant condition or requirement.

38.3

Except as provided by the regulations, the validity of an order made by virtue
of paragraph  37 (2) (a)  or  (b)  is not to be questioned in any legal
proceedings.

###### Penalties

39

39.1

Regulations made by virtue of  paragraph 37 (2) (c)  may, in particular—

39.1.a

make provision about the maximum amount that may be imposed by way of penalty;

39.1.b

make provision about procedure;

39.1.c

make provision about the payment of interest;

39.1.d

specify how a penalty (and any interest) may be recovered;

39.1.e

make provision about payment of a penalty (and any interest) in instalments;

39.1.f

require sums received by way of penalty (and interest) to be paid into—

39.1.f.i

the Consolidated Fund, or

39.1.f.ii

in relation to Northern Ireland, the Consolidated Fund of Northern Ireland;

39.1.g

make provision enabling the Regulator to accept an enforcement undertaking
from a relevant person and about the consequences of accepting such an
undertaking.

39.2

The regulations may provide for—

39.2.a

publication by the Regulator of a statement of policy with respect to the
imposition of penalties and the determination of their amount;

39.2.b

revision of the statement of policy.

39.3

Where regulations make provision by virtue of  paragraph 37 (2) (c)  for the
imposition of a penalty on a relevant person, the regulations—

39.3.a

must also include provision enabling the relevant person to challenge the
penalty in legal proceedings;

39.3.b

may, in particular, specify the grounds on which and the time within which a
penalty may be challenged and the remedies that may be given.

39.4

Except as provided by the regulations, the validity of a penalty imposed by
virtue of paragraph  37  is not to be questioned in any legal proceedings.

###### Consumer redress orders

40

40.1

Regulations made by virtue of  paragraph 37 (2) (d)  may, in particular—

40.1.a

make provision about the requirements that may be imposed by a consumer
redress order, including, in particular, requirements as to—

40.1.a.i

paying compensation to affected heat network consumers;

40.1.a.ii

preparing and distributing a written statement about the contravention;

40.1.a.iii

terminating or varying contracts entered into with affected heat network
consumers;

40.1.b

make provision about the maximum amount of compensation that a relevant person
may be required to pay;

40.1.c

make provision about procedure;

40.1.d

make provision about challenges to a consumer redress order in legal
proceedings (including, in particular, specifying the grounds on which and the
time within which an order may be challenged and the remedies that may be
given);

40.1.e

make provision about the payment of interest;

40.1.f

make provision about payment of compensation (and any interest) in
instalments;

40.1.g

specify how a consumer redress order may be enforced;

40.1.h

make provision enabling the Regulator to accept an enforcement undertaking
from a relevant person and about the consequences of accepting such an
undertaking.

40.2

The regulations may provide for—

40.2.a

publication by the Regulator of a statement of policy with respect to the
making of consumer redress orders and the determination of the requirements
imposed by them;

40.2.b

revision of the statement of policy.

40.3

Except as provided by the regulations, the validity of a consumer redress
order is not to be questioned in any legal proceedings.

###### Functions under Part 1 of the Competition Act 1998 and Part 4 of the Enterprise Act 2002

41

41.1

The regulations may make provision for the purpose of enabling the Regulator
to exercise such functions of the Competition and Markets Authority under Part
1 of the Competition Act 1998, or such descriptions of those functions, as are
specified in the regulations.

41.2

The regulations may make provision for the purpose of enabling the Regulator
to exercise such functions of the Competition and Markets Authority under Part
4 of the Enterprise Act 2002, or such descriptions of those functions, as are
specified in the regulations.

41.3

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  or  (2)  may, in particular,
make provision—

41.3.a

about the concurrent exercise of functions by the Regulator and the
Competition and Markets Authority;

41.3.b

for the joint exercise of functions by the Regulator and the Competition and
Markets Authority in a particular case;

41.3.c

as to the procedure for determining which of the Regulator and the Competition
and Markets Authority is to exercise functions in a particular case;

41.3.d

as to the circumstances in which the exercise of a function by the Regulator
or the Competition and Markets Authority precludes the exercise of the
function by the other;

41.3.e

about assistance that may be given by the Regulator to the Competition and
Markets Authority.

##### Investigation

###### Investigation of charges

42

42.1

The regulations may make provision about how the Regulator is to determine
whether charges payable by heat network consumers for, or in relation to,
heating, cooling or hot water supplied by means of a relevant heat network
contravene a condition of a heat network authorisation by reason of being
disproportionate (see  paragraph 14 (5) (b) ).

42.2

The regulations may, in particular, make provision enabling the Regulator to
specify from time to time the methods that are to be used by the Regulator to
determine whether charges are disproportionate.

###### Powers to require information etc

43

43.1

The regulations may make provision conferring powers on the Regulator or
imposing requirements on any person, for the purposes of or in connection with
enabling the Regulator—

43.1.a

to monitor and secure compliance with relevant conditions or requirements;

43.1.b

to make an order in respect of the contravention of a relevant condition or
requirement;

43.1.c

to enforce relevant conditions or requirements;

43.1.d

to make a determination under provision made by virtue of paragraph  42 (1) .

43.2

Regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1)  may, in particular, enable
the Regulator—

43.2.a

to require information to be supplied;

43.2.b

to require copies of documents to be provided;

43.2.c

to inspect premises;

43.2.d

to inspect and take copies of documents or records;

43.2.e

to conduct tests or to require tests to be conducted;

43.2.f

to require a person to produce any equipment, document or record and to make
available information stored electronically;

43.2.g

to seize and detain equipment, documents and records.

43.3

Regulations made by virtue of sub-paragraph (1) may, in particular—

43.3.a

confer powers to enter premises for the purposes of exercising powers
conferred by the regulations;

43.3.b

make provision about the circumstances in which a warrant is required to
exercise a power conferred by virtue of paragraph (a);

43.3.c

make provision for the issuing of such a warrant where conditions specified in
the regulations are satisfied.

43.4

The regulations may provide for the Regulator to authorise others to exercise
powers conferred on it by regulations made by virtue of  sub-paragraph (1) .
